loans.name: Halal

texts.en:
Ahmed is 26 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hard-working and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead.

All his life he has been working hard and earning money to assist his family. He is a kind man who works as an employer in the military making a low salary. His salary is not enough to cover household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan of YER 100,000 to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been running her own beauty parlor for the past 11 years. She is doing her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling very well. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient so she is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy more beauty products such as lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. With this loan, she will be able to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flowers and gifts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set and a weighing scale so she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Violah

texts.en:
Violah is 29 years old and married, and she supports three members of her family.

She runs a cereals business in Kapsabet town, which is served by the KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for three years.  She earns an average monthly income of KES 10,000.She plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 50,000  to buy more stocks, that is, maize and beans of different varieties. 

Her dream is to educate her children and to start a wholesale enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize and beans of different varieties

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 43 years old and married, with three children, ages 10, 7, and 5 years, whom she supports. 

Beatrice  was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet staff member, and she is a taking her second loan from KADET of KES 20,000.  She has run a café business for a year and a half, which is located at Timboni. She earns monthly income of KES 2,750. 

She will use the loan to add stock for her business:  wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and utensils. Her previous loan of KES 15,000 was paid back successfully.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her cafe. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to expand her business by making it a hotel and to educate and make sure her children live well.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to make food for her customers.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with nine children, four of whom are in school. The rest of her children have completed school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ega prepares goat meat and soup using goat heads and legs and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married and has two school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is divorced with two children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling flat bread and dumplings to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Anney

texts.en:
Anney is a 37-year-old, industrious, single mother of two children, aged eleven and two years old. She learned about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from business colleagues who are members of KADET. For the last seven years, she has run a general retail shop on the outskirts of Narok town, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Anney has been advanced a second loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, after successfully paying off the first one. She intends to use the funds to buy additional consumable goods for the retail shop. The proceeds will be used to cater to her family's basic needs. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married and her husband works as a steel bender. They have two children whose ages are 8 and 13. They are currently attending school and living at home. Beatrice attended school and stopped in the 11th grade before starting her business. Her business involves selling oil, pepper, vita, salt, okra, etc. in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more oil, pepper, vita, salt, okra, etc. to resell. She said that besides fewer goods on her table market, she has no other problems. With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish this business. She learned the business by watching other businesswomen two years ago. She enjoys the flow of customers. Her dream is to move from a table to a shop business.

loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, vita, salt, okra, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married, with three children, all of whom attend school.  They are the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Halima has operated a cafe business making dishes like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and to become an important person in the society.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married, and she has three school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. Beside the poultry business, she sells women's clothes to town sellers and passersby.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards.  Her loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used for her business.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stocks of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, donde su población se decía al cultivo de maíz, yuca y arroz, comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia emprendedora que se esfuerza, Norma junto a su esposo se dedican a la crianza de cerdos y venta de los mismos, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertir en compra de cerdos pequeños y alimentos balanceados, para luego ofrecerlos en las comunidades aledañas a su comunidad y de esta manera generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old and lives with her husband in the District of Oyotun.  This area is known for growing corn, cassava, and rice, as well as the sale of small animals.  The community is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.  

Norma’s family is an enterprising group.  She and her husband raise and sell pigs.  Norma is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN so that she can buy piglets and balanced feed in order to sell them later in the neighboring communities in her area.  This will allow her to generate income for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a grader and a clutter plough for his rice areas.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen with her nice family lives in Gavar city, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is 39 years old, and she has a son and a daughter. Her son is school-aged, and her daughter studies at the Gavar State University with the faculty of History. Askhen’s husband is in the Russian Federation as a foreign worker.

Despite having a specialty of pediatrician, Ashkhen is fully engaged in farming. In her farm she has two cows, a bull, and four calves. She sells milk and meat from her house. Her husband from time to time sends some money that he has managed to save, and together with her farming income Ashkhen takes care of her children and the farm. 

She asks a loan of AMD 500,000 to buy a lot of animal fodder so her farm cattle can pass the winter.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder, so her farm cattle can pass the winter

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is Mwanamisi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables for her business. 

She would now like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000, to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs . She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Soemant

texts.en:
Mr. Soemant is 37 years old and has a family with a school-going child. He is a rice grower and, in his spare time, he works as a bus driver. 

Soemant has inherited a plot of land from his father. In 2009, he expanded his rental plots with the support from Stichting SEVA Microfinance Institute (SEVA MFI). His past loans are all fully repaid. 

Now, his next goal is to buy a second-hand tractor that will enable him to produce more efficiently. To save for his tractor, he needs to expand production. He approached SEVA MFI for a new loan of SRD 10,000.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, diesel fuel, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Abiebatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Abiebatu, who is from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three  children between the ages of 7 years and 12 years.  

Abiebatu runs a cookery business at home; she sells cookery food at her house. She has been running this business since after the war. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Rebecca says the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient finance to expand.

Abiebatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. 

The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Ehtidal

texts.en:
Ehtidal is a respectful and, above all, a hard-working 24-year-old. 

With great effort, she started her own business selling lingerie in 2012. Her business was launched with barely enough amount of money that she had saved. Today, Ehtidal is quite confident that the more she has items to sell, the higher the income she will earn. 

So, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory and reach what she is aiming for, especially by offering her clients high-quality products at low prices. 

Her dream is to have a bigger business.  And to make it a reality, she is working harder and harder each day to improve her income.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 49 years old. She is married and supports her only (1) child aged 22 years old. Christine was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET staff member and she is a taking her first loan from KADET of KSHS 15 000. She has had rental houses for the last three years now located at Timboni and she earns a monthly income of KSHS 8,200. She will use the loan to renovate her houses. She will use the anticipated profit to expand and build another rental house. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to build other rental houses and make sure her child lives well.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Gilles

texts.en: Gilles is a Cameroonian aged 34, married with three children. The oldest is twelve years old and in secondary school while the youngest is 9 and in primary school.Gilles has been in this business for the past nine years which makes him very experienced, and his business very stable and profitable.  He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban center with many potential customers. This loan will help him increase his turnover from one million F CFA to over one million two hundred thousand F CFA monthly.

loans.use: To buy communication credit

loans.name: Valeriane

texts.en:
Valeriane is 28 years old and lives in the village of Tskhentaro. He is single and lives with his parents. Valeriane grows grapes. He produces wine with the harvested grapes and sells his production at the local open market. In addition, he breeds a milk cow and several sheep and takes good care of his livestock.

His income from agriculture is seasonal and Valeriane decided to earn a stable income. That’s why Valeriane decided to apply for this loan and started his greenhouse business. He is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering him, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase all the needed materials for his greenhouse construction. He plans to grow various greens in wintertime and plant tomatoes and cucumbers in summer. He will sell his harvest the whole year and generate income. Thanks to this loan, he will improve their quality of life and increase the family funds. Valeriane awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is a 55-year-old farmer who lives in Meru, which is located in the Mount Kenya region.  She has been farming for seven years.  In addition to growing tea and a variety of other crops, she also rears cows and poultry on her farm.  She earns an income through the sale of milk, tea, crops and eggs.  She says that she is motivated by the bonuses she receives at the end of the year.   

This loan will help her buy a water tank for easier storage of water especially during dry spells.  Kellen said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are affordable and their loan officers are very friendly.  After attending the microfinance training session required by Juhudi, she said that the loan is for helping the lowly and economically productive.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mafinga Group

texts.en:
Leonard who is in his early 20s is single.  He has been running a bakery business making small cakes and big cakes for big occasions.  He has been in this business for three years now.  He works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Leonard's first loan, which he wants to use to buy more baking flour, sugar, eggs and cooking fat to make more cakes. He dreams of buying an international baking machine for better quality baking cakes faster. 

Leonard will share this loan with his loan group MAFINGA, which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, eggs and cooking fat to make more cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in handcrafted masks and desk sets. He would like to invest in the purchase of ebony wood, leather, brass, polish and sandpaper to increase production. Francis has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: "I come from a family of traditional wood carvers. While at school, funding was becoming a difficulty, so during weekends and vacations, I would visit my father's workshop and assist him by carving some products for sale. The realization eventually dawned on me to stay on, work on my own designs, and display my own woodcarvings. I opened a new workshop which my sister and a cousin manage and together we preserve the family legacy." "Thank you all for this micro-credit, because it will allow me to double my stock, and this translates into an increase in sales." Use the link below to view Francis's wooden masks and leather desk sets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3835

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ebony wood, leather, brass, polish and sandpaper to increase production

loans.name: Juliene Cimolice

texts.en: Juliene is a Cameroonian aged 42, married with four children. The oldest is twenty years old and in university and the youngest is 10 and in primary school. Juliene has been in this business for the past seventeen years which makes her very experienced and her business very stable and profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help her increase her profit by 24 percent and her living standard will be improved as well.

loans.use: To buy raw food to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an iron, and some fabric.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. Mabel is 46 years old, single, with a 21-year-old child who attends school. For the past two years now she has been running a table at the market where she sells cooking oil. She started this business with money from her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil for her business; she wants to get more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil for her business;

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
Doña María Estela tiene una edad de 45 años ella está acompañada (unión libre) y es madre de 10 hijos por los que da gracias a DIOS por haber permitido tener una familia numerosa y sana. 5 de sus hijos aún viven con ella los cuales son menores de edad y están en edad escolar y los 5 mayores ya están en hogares a parte y contribuyen con las diferentes actividades del campo. Ella no pudo estudiar en su juventud ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no pudieron apoyarle con sus sueños por lo que decidieron enseñarle a trabajar la tierra mostrando ella un gran interés por lo que sus padres hacían. Ella cuanta con un terreno el cual fue herencia de sus padres en donde ella tiene cultivado café como también una pequeña pulpería con la que ayuda a su conyugue a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Sus clientes son las bodegas de café en las zonas aledañas, vecinos e intermediarios que buscan de un buen producto para revender. 
Ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como urea, abono, entre otros con los que podrá asistir su cosecha de café con la cual al final de la temporada espera obtener muy buenas ganancias y seguir re invirtiendo en las mismas.      
Sus planes para el futuro son los de seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra y de esa forma sembrar una mayor cantidad de café. Como madre sus sueños son los de poder darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de estudiar para que ellos se formen a nivel profesional y puedan ser personas preparadas académicamente.
texts.en:
María Estela is 45 years old. She is in a civil partnership and is the mother of 10 children. She gives thanks to God for having allowed her to have a large and healthy family. Five of her children, who are minors, still live with her. The five older children already live on their own and contribute with their various agricultural work. 

In her youth, María Estela was unable to study because her parents lacked the resources and were unable to support her in her dreams. They decided to teach her to work the land, because she showed a great interest in her parent's work. 

She has a plot of land which she inherited from her parents where she cultivates coffee and runs a small general store to help her spouse with the household finances. Her customers include coffee warehouses in nearby regions, neighbours and middlemen who are looking for high quality products to resell. 

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as urea, fertilizer, and other items that will benefit her coffee harvest. With this, by the end of the season, she expects to make a very good profit and be able to reinvest in her crop. 

Her future plans include further expanding her coffee crop by purchasing more land. This will enable her to plant a larger amount of coffee. As a mother, her dream is to be able to give her children the opportunity to study, so that they can become professionals and academically prepared people.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mujeres Dispuestas A Crecer 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres dispuestas a crecer (Women willing to grow) 1.  Her group is located in Puerto Plata. She makes her home in a simple structure, with her long-term partner and their two children. This group is made up of five women developing businesses in their rural town. 

Ana is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. She has her own business, which she started with some savings almost nine years ago. 

She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory by buying men's and women's shoes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save for her future plans. Ana says her most difficult challenge is to finish building her house. In the meantime, she continues to enjoy selling. 

Her dreams are to work hard and move her business forward, and, with the help of God, she will. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk is from Geghasar village, where he lives with his parents (in the photo), his wife and two little children, 7 and 3 years old (in the photo). Near the village where Hayk and his family live, he owns a plot of agricultural land, where he cultivates different types of fruits and vegetables. Hayk has been also been involved in breeding cattle for many years. As the only breadwinner in the family, Hayk feels very responsible for earning a good income to cover his family's basic costs. This hardworking man with a good credit history behind him is asking for financial support. He needs US$3,000 to buy potato, wheat and barley seeds and to enlarge his cultivation activities. Hayk will be able to sell his harvest in the market and earn more income. This is the reason why he has applied for this loan. The loan is important for Hayk, as agriculture is the only source of his income, and he hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for potato, wheat and barley seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale, so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Alba Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Alba tiene una edad de 41 años ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales 3 de ellos ayudan con las diferentes actividades como la aplicación de abono, limpieza, aplicación de fertilizantes, etc. y el menor que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella es casada y tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 5 grado ya que por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ella no pudo culminar sus estudios. Ella cuanta con un terreno el cual fue herencia de sus padres en donde ella tiene cultivado café por lo que decidió aprender esta actividad a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia la agricultura es una tradición la cual las ganancias que deja el cultivo de café cuando es un producto bien atendido y cuidado son muchas como también el medio único se sustento que en su familia ha existido por muchas generaciones. Sus clientes son las bodegas de café en las zonas aledañas, vecinos e intermediarios que buscan de un buen producto para revender. 
Ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como urea, abono, entre otros con los que podrá asistir su cosecha de café con la cual al final de la temporada espera obtener muy buenas ganancias y seguir re invirtiendo en las mismas.      
Sus planes para el futuro son los de seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra y de esa forma sembrar una mejor y mayor cantidad de café. Como madre sus sueños son los de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su vivienda, entre otras necesidades que son necesarias atenderlas como las medicinas que son adquiridas con muchas restricciones entre otras.
texts.en:
Alba is 41 years old. She is married and she is the mother of four children. Three of her children help her with different tasks like applying the fertilizer, cleaning, etc. The youngest child attends a local school. She has a fifth grade primary education.. Due to a lack of economic support from her parents, she could not finish her studies. 
Alba has a plot of land that belonged to her parents where she grows coffee. She decided to learn this work activity at a very young age. In her family, farming is a tradition. The profits from harvesting coffee when the crop is well attended and cared for are high. Also, it has been the only means of support for many generations. Her customers are the coffee shops in the surrounding areas, neighbors and intermediaries looking for a good product to resell. 

Today, she is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies like urea, fertilizer and other items which will assist her coffee harvest. With the end of the season, she hopes to earn very good profits and to reinvest in her crops. 

Her plans for the future is to continue expanding her coffee crops by purchasing more land. By doing this, she can grow a better and greater quantity of coffee. As a mother, her dream is to improve the living conditions of her family like her home and other necessities like medications that are acquired with many restrictions.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Amistad 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of this group called Amistad (Friendship) 4. Ana is the single mother of three children. 

Her business consists of making hair products like shampoo, conditioner, and anti-frizz serum, as well as disinfectants for floors and home surfaces. Ana purchases chemicals from local distributors to make her products and packs them for distribution. Her finished products are sold in small grocery stores and in her own home. In addition, Ana is a dressmaker, sewing clothes and decorative pieces like curtains, bathroom sets, and bedspreads. 

With this loan, Ana will buy chemical products (sodium chloride, boric acid, menthol, methyl salicylate, glycerin, fruit fragrance, cetyl alcohol, etc.) for hair and household products. 

Ana’s most important challenge is to see her children become professionals. God has given her the strength to work hard as a single mother, to provide for her family, and to send her children to study. 

She enjoys sewing and making products. She has received 18 loans with Esperanza, and with her first loan, she bought a sewing machine and started making student uniforms. 

Ana's dream is to have a big factory to produce her chemical-based products and to sell them in other cities and in big department stores. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy chemical products to produce hair products and cleaning products; also fabrics to sew

loans.name: Las Cumplidoras Group

texts.en: The ladies of the Friendship Bridge trust bank, “Las Cumplidoras”, completed another loan cycle a few days ago. In the process of development, they have grown to 10 members, and they are now applying for another loan cycle. Las Cumplidoras are neighbors and friends from Olintepeque City, a 20-minute drive from Quetzaltenango in Western Guatemala. Thanks to the Friendship Bridge loans, these ladies have expanded their businesses and increased their income, allowing them to support their families in ways they formerly thought impossible. Eva Maria, who was reported on in a previous loan cycle, is making good progress in her business. The other ladies also are also making progress. In this new cycle, we want to introduce Claudia, an 18-year-old lady. Due to her family’s economic situation, Claudia was only able to attend school through the 6th grade. She sells fruit in the market, about 20 minutes away from her home. She works a 12-hour day (6 am to 6 pm) 6 days per week. In her first Friendship Bridge loan cycle, Claudia is applying for US$384 in order to buy a variety of fruits, including watermelons, papaya, pineapples and mandarin oranges, which she can sell along with the pieces of fruit she currently sells. Claudia’s father passed away 8 years ago. Therefore, all the income she generates from her fruit sales goes to support her mother and her four younger siblings, whose education she wants to help continue. They are now are in the 4th through the 9th grades. In this first loan cycle, Claudia will have the opportunity to share her experiences. During the monthly trainings, she will also learn from the other ladies about children’s education, women’s health and business, and money management among many other important topics.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell, including watermelons, papaya, pineapples and mandarin oranges.

loans.name: Bathelemy

texts.en: Bathelemy is a young Cameroonian, aged 34, single, with a child in primary school who is five. He has been in this business for the past eight years, which makes him very experienced and his business profitable and stable. His business is located in an urban area, which makes it likely to succeed because there are many potential customers. This loan will help him to increase his profit by 23 percent, and to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wood to use in making chairs and tables.

loans.name: Kadek

texts.en:
Kadek is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as sterling silver and gemstones to increase production. Kadek has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "I was literally born into the world of jewelry-making. My parents and most people in my neighborhood are silversmiths. My parents used to say, if you make something, don't use only your hands but also all of your heart. This way everything you make will have spirit." "Thank you for funding this micro-credit, because by purchasing the raw materials I need, production can increase and sales improve. This makes it easier for me to continue paying the artisans in my team in a timely manner." Use the link below to view Kadek's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5917

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as sterling silver and gemstones to increase production

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a Ghanaian artisan who creates vivid and beautiful African masks. He hopes to stock up on wood, sandpaper and polish for production. Walter has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "I have my own workshop, where I design and carve the things I like. I carve different masks that represent the value of the family, unity and our ancestors. African masks have a strong social, ethnic, historic and symbolic meaning." "I will ever be grateful for the help you are giving me to help my workshop grow. Thank you!" Use the link below to view Walter's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4531

loans.use: to stock up on wood, sandpaper and polish for production

loans.name: Ejemplo A Seguir 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Ejemplo a Seguir ("Example to follow") 5. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Carmen makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business which is a bookstore. She will use this loan to increase her business inventory buying books, notebooks, colored pencils and other items. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business. Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid a previous loan and grown her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy books, notebooks, pencils, pens, etc

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, de 51 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada a las afueras de la ciudad. El trabajo al que se dedica de manera constante es la venta de bebidas y comida en un pequeña tienda que posee en su misma casa, desde muy joven comenzó con este negocio es por esa razón que siempre quiere mejorar y crecer. Comenta que los días en los que recibe mayor visita son los fines de semana y las fechas festivas; pues recibe turistas de todas partes del mundo ya que visitan la selva central. Ahora ella desea mejorar la atención y ambientación de su restaurante turístico para de esa manera recibir cada día más turistas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el primer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Cecilia, invertirá los S/.1000 en la compra de bebidas la por mayor, además de productos de primera necesidad por sacos como arroz y azúcar.
texts.en: Fifty-one-year-old Cecilia is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband and children, whom she looks after in their own house in the outskirts of the city.  Cecilia is constantly working selling food and drinks in a small shop that she runs out of her home.  She started this business from a very young age and so always wants to expand and improve it.  Cecilia tells us that she has more customers at the weekends, and on bank holidays.  She has tourists from all over the world who come to visit the jungle.  Cecilia now wants to improve the service and premises of her tourist restaurant so that she can have more tourists as customers.  Cecilia is part of the "Las Brisas" communal bank and this is her first loan with Kiva.  She is happy to continue working with the members of the bank, who are welcoming, responsible, and caring people.  Cecilia will invest the 1000 Nuevo Soles in buying drinks in bulk.  She will also buy staple goods such as rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 2 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members of El Gran Esfuerzo (The Big Effort) 2 group, which is located in the town of Hato Mayor. The town's economy depends on farming, and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. The group's main business activity is selling clothes, and most of the members who make up this group are Haitian immigrants. 

Carmen has 10 children, and some of them live together with her and her long term partner, the father of most of her children. She says that her greatest challenge is to have her own house, in Dominican Republic or in Haiti, which is the reason why she has been working hard. Carmen is very excited to be receiving her 14th loan from Esperanza International after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans, thereby being given a step forward in the growth of her business. 

She has had her business for almost 15 years. She set up her business with some capital by two or three pieces of clothes, cosmetics, and others. She started growing it with her first loan from Esperanza. Carmen is planning to invest her new loan in buying clothes, cosmetics, and shoes for women, men, and kids, as well as some women's accessories. She plans to use her profits to save for her future dreams. 

In the picture: Eduardo didn't look to the camera and his face wasn't easy to distinguish so a small picture was added in the bottom right corner.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food suplies

loans.name: Alexandra Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora Alexandra es una socia que está conformando el grupo de crédito Los Talvos desde hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo ha estableció una mejor amistad con todas los miembros del grupo ya que son como una familia. Vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene verdes campos y amplias praderas, es una mezcla de la arquitectura moderna y la antigua, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales y agricultura, pero siempre están dispuestos a mejora su estabilidad económica con su esfuerzo y trabajo.
La Señora Alexandra tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 2 niños de 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo  labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.
Doña Alexandra pasa en casa al cuidado de su hogar pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la crianza de animales como es cerdos y pollos, la cosecha de su agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para la venta. Su meta es crecer en el negocio de animales.
texts.en:
Alexandra has been a member of the "Los Talvos" group for four years.  During this time she has established strong friendships with all the members of the group, which is now like a family.  Alexandra lives in the Valle en Cuenca parish, which is filled with green fields and expanse meadows.  The area has a mixture of both old and modern architecture.  The people make a living raising animals, and in farming, but they are always looking to improve their financial stability through effort and hard work.

Alexandra is 22 years old, is married and has two children, aged five and two years old respectively.  The eldest is attending one of the local schools. Alexandra's husband works as a builder.  The family does not have their own house, so the are staying with relatives.  Alexandra stays at home to look after the home but, in order to support the family economy, she also works raising animals such as pigs and chickens.  She sells some of her products, and keeps the rest for the family to consume.

This loan will be invested in buying chickens and pigs to sell.  Alexandra's goal is to expand her animal business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is widowed with five children. She is 65 years old and lives in Padaian-Napolan, Pagadian City.

She sells goods and dry goods to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amount of 13,000 PHP to buy goods and dry goods. Roberta has been a member of PMPC for one year. 

In the future, Roberta hopes to have her own stall to display her products.

loans.use: to buy goods and dry goods.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 23 years old and lives in Barangay Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is an orphan and single.

Elisa has a sari-sari store. She is new to this business. She requested a loan for beginning capital for her sari-sari store. Elisa is a new member of PMPC.  

In the future, Elisa hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma.Gina joined PMPC last September 2013. She appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the coop. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that PMPC offers.

Ma. Gina is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to purchase piglets and feeds for her hog-raising business.

Ma. Gina dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Ermie

texts.en: Ermie is a 50 year old widow and has two children who are in school and residents of Brgy. Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Starting with 3,500 PHP of capital, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member on June 30, 2011. Now she is applying for a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 55 years old and a widow. She has two children and she is a resident of Brgy, Polao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Starting with capitalization of PHP 2,000, Fely opened a sari-sari (general store) and she was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in July 2013. 

Now, Fely is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and she will be fully satisfied, if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is from Pugwan, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 52 years old. She is a widow with 10 children. She has been in the farming business for 30 years. 

In 2013, Esmaelita applied for membership in PMPC. She has been enjoying the benefits and privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Recently, she applied for a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Esmaelita deeply wishes to maintain her membership with PMPC in good standing.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is widowed with 5 children. She is 54 years old and lives at Brgy. Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Eliza is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Eliza has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizer and for the maintenance of her rice field. She has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. 

In the future, Eliza hopes to own a rice field.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maintainance for her rice field.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 21 years old, is married, has one child, and lives at Brgy, Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental,  Philippines. With a desire to earn more money, she decided to raise pigs.
 
Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she obtained the capital to purchase piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional piglets and feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, Jessa wants to build her own concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is from Sta. Filomena Dipolog City. She is 40 years old and is married with four kids. 

In 2012, Julita applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Julita asked for financial assistance of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy ingredients for her barbeque and food vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. 

She found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her barbeque and food vending business.

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en:
Tranquilina is 55 years old and is a resident of Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married, with five children. She earns a living through farming. 

In July 2013, Tranquilina applied her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing about all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and she repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Tranquilina asked for financial assistance of PHP 25,000 to pay for her farmland preparation (plowing, leveling, and cleaning of dikes) and seedbed preparation (mounting of beds, seed sowing, and maintenance). Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her business.  

She has found assistance for their financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for farmland preparation and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 53 años es una madre de familia que ama los cultivos, ella está casada con Luis, ambos tienen un hijo Jarol, con quien vive en su casa propia ubicada a las afueras de la ciudad. Mientras que su esposo labora como mecánico de aviación ella, desde hace 16 años cuida con mucho amor sus cultivos de frutas cítricas, café y plátanos, con la contratación de operarios, quienes dejan limpios sus plantaciones.  A ella le gusta cosechar sus productos porque en ellos observa que valió la pena los esfuerzos realizados, además como algunos terrenos están cerca cosecha principalmente sus naranjas para consumo, por otro lado, cuenta que le resulta difícil guardarlos para comercializarlos a los acopiadores de su ciudad o a los mayoristas del mercado, porque le conviene venderlos en las mismas chacras, asegura que gracias a la agricultura tiene su casa propia, terrenos y puede vivir sin preocupaciones, pero también , es consciente de que más adelante se limitará a arrendar sus tierras, por eso como cuenta con un espacio en su domicilio, piensa instalar una bodega muy bien surtida de productos comestibles. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables.Francisca, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and is the mother of a family that loves farming. She is married to Luis and they have a son, Jarol, with whom they live in a house they own located outside the city. While her husband works in aviation mechanics, for the last sixteen years she has cared for her crops of citrus fruits, coffee and plantains with a lot of love, hiring workers to leave her crops clean. She likes to harvest her products because in them she sees that the efforts made were worthwhile, also as some lands are near harvest, primarily her oranges for consumption. She also says that it is difficult for her to keep them to sell to the collectors in her city or to the wholesalers from the market, because it suits her to sell them at the same farms.

She asserts that she has her own house and lands due to agriculture, and she is able to live without concerns, but she is also aware that she will be limited to leasing out her lands in the future. For this reason she has a space in her home and intends to open a grocery store that is very well stocked with food products.
 
She belongs to the “Las brisas” communal bank and this is their third loan with KIVA. She is happy to keep working with the members of the communal bank, who are very caring, welcoming and responsible people. Francisca will invest the 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nurture her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa  tem  38 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de cinco filhos. A sua base de sustento é o negócio  que está a fazer desde o ano de 1992.
     Ela trabalha todos dias  na sua loja de bebidas com ajuda dos filhos.  Durante o mes ela faz 3 a 4 viagens regulares para  África do sul  onde compra  parte da sua mercadoria.
   Com o empréstimo ela vai comprar carnes diversas e derivados, óleo e refrigerantes para revender.
    Ela gostaria de se tornar a maior fornecedora de productos  na sua região porém ela tem o desafio de aumentar a frequência das suas viagens de forma a satisfazer a demanda,, e por outro lado pagar o empréstimo dentro do tempo estabelecido.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old. She's married and has five children. Her means of livelihood is her business, which she has run since 1992.
She works everyday in her beverage store and gets help from her children. She makes 3 to 4 trips a month to South Africa, where she buys part of her merchandise.
With the loan she'll purchase various types of meat and meat products, cooking oil and soft drinks for re-selling.
She would like to become the biggest merchandise supplier in her area. However, she faces the challenge of increasing the frequency of her trips so she can meet the demand. Another challenge is repaying the loan within the scheduled time frame.

loans.use: to purchase various types of meat and meat products, cooking oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Noemia

texts.pt:
Noémia  tem 44 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 04 (quatro ) filhos.
Ela trabalha para o ministério do interior como policia guarda, e para além disso ela vende carnes diversas para aumentar as sua receitas.
Ela precisa de empréstimo para comprar frangos e carnes diversas para revender.
O seu maior sonho é de comprar uma viatura minibus para transporte de passageiros.
 Tem como desafio fazer poupanças de dinheiro para  comprar a  viatura.
texts.en:
Noémia is 44 years old. She's married and has four children.
She works as a police officer for the Ministry of the Interior. Aside from that, she sells various types of meat so she can increase her income.
She needs a loan in order to purchase chickens and various types of meat for re-selling.
Her biggest dream is to purchase a vehicle such as a minibus for carrying passengers.
Her challenge is saving money to buy the vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and various types of meat.

loans.name: Clara Eulalia

texts.es:
La Señora Clara se encuentra en el segundo crédito que está realizando a lado de sus compañeras del grupo de crédito Los Talvos, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene verdes campos y amplias praderas, es una mezcla de la arquitectura moderna y la antigua, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales y agricultura, pero siempre están dispuestos a mejora su estabilidad económica con su esfuerzo y trabajo. Le gusta mucho este grupo ya que más que amigas ya todas son una familia que lucha por un objetivo en común el bienestar de sus familias.
La Señora Clara tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 9, 8 y 7 años de edad, todos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Clara se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero como vive en el campo se dedica a la crianza de animales como aves y cuyes, la cosecha que realiza de la agricultura es para su casa y la venta, con el primer crédito que realizo en su grupo inicio con una pequeña tienda la cual va creciendo poco a poco. 
Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para así prosperar más en su tienda. Su meta es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
This is Clara’s second loan with her communal bank Los Talvos. She lives in the Valle parish in Cuenca, which is filled with green fields and extensive meadows. The area has a blend of modern and old architecture. The people there make a living raising animals and working in agriculture, but they are always looking to improve their financial stability through their effort and hard work. Clara really likes this group since they are more than just friends; they are a family that strives for a common goal: the well-being of their families.

Clara is 31 years old. She is a single mother of three children that are 9, 8, and 7 years old. All of them are studying in a local school. Clara owns the house she lives in.

Clara is a homemaker, but since she lives in the countryside, she makes a living raising animals such as birds and guinea pigs. She sells some of her products and keeps the rest for her family to consume. With her first loan, she opened a small store that is growing little by little.

With the money from her new loan, she is going to invest in the purchase of groceries for her store so that it can prosper. Her goal is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда живет в сельской местности на северной части Таджикистана. Ей 26 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 сына, которому 2 года. Более 7 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход она продает на рынке. Так как у нее высококачественный урожай, так и ее товары имеют большой спрос. Ее муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Она планирует провести мероприятие дома, но она не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить продукты питания и пригласить гостей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khursheda lives in the countryside, in the northern region of Tajikistan.  She is 26 years old, married and has a two year old son.  For more than seven years, she has been growing crops such as potatoes, wheat, and carrots.  She sells her produce at the market.  Since she grows high quality crops, her merchandise is in very high demand.  Her husband is helping her with this business.  Khursheda is planning to have a celebration, but she does not have enough money to purchase food for all of the guests.  She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to organize this event.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To organize a celebration

loans.name: Reymondo

texts.en:
Reymondo is 33 years old, single and a resident of Dontolan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He earns a living through dried fish selling.

He has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy 50 kilos of dried fish to sell.

Reymondo deeply wishes to maintain his status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and has five children. She is 49 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Emma sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as sardines, noodles, eggs, assorted biscuits, candies, chocolates, junk foods, drinks, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to put up other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as sardines, noodles, eggs, assorted biscuits, candies, chocolates, junk foods, drinks, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Doña Erminia tiene 52 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos, agricultora, ama de casa y comerciante ya que tiene una pequeña pulpería con la contribuye al ingreso económico en su hogar la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación siendo sus clientes los vecinos y amigos que llegan a la zona, con un grado de educación primario completo. En compañía de su esposo el cual es agricultor trabajan la tierra en lo que es el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol el cual es propio y agradecen a DIOS por tener una tierra en la cual puedan cultivar lo propio y obtener las ganancias netas. Sus cultivos están ubicados cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando ya que en tiempo son aproximadamente 15 minutos. 
Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café con los cuales busca obtener una mejor cosecha y asegurar el producto final de plagas y bichos.
Los planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café ya que de esta forma ella podrá obtener mejores ingresos con la agricultura y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y demás necesidades que se presenten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Erminia is 52, a mother of three, a farmer, a housewife and a shopkeeper, since she has a small neighbourhood grocery store that she uses to contribute to the family income. The shop is located inside her house and her customers are her neighbours and friends who come to the area. She is educated up to primary level. Erminia and her husband, who is a farmer, work the land growing coffee, maize and beans. They thank God because they have their own land to cultivate their crops and earn a net profit. Their crops are located near the house about 15 minutes’ walk away. 

Erminia has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy agricultural materials to grow maize, beans and coffee. This will enable her to obtain a better harvest and assure a final product that is free from pests and vermin. Future plans are to be able to grow a better variety of coffee. In this way she can improve her income through agriculture and continue to support her children in their studies and to cover any other needs they might have in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help grow maize, beans and coffee.

loans.name: Agnaldo

texts.en:
Agnaldo, 33, came to Sorocaba 12 years ago and began to shine shoes to help his family. He stayed for 10 years in this profession until he met a client who helped him find work as a driver in his company. He learned to drive a truck and still works in this field. At age 18 he married Alessandra, they have a daughter who is now 11 years old, and a stepson who is 20 years old. His wife works as a housemaid and sells clothes. Agnaldo always liked cars, and to supplement the family income he began buying beat up old cars and motorcycles with problems, which he refurbishes and resells. He will use this loan to buy a car and motorcycle to repair and resell.

He has borrowed from Banco Pérola before and has an excellent track record with the institution, with no late payment installments, and he has shown himself to be very devoted during the monitoring process. He has an entrepreneurial spirit and is a great seller.

loans.use: to buy a car and motorcycle to repair and resell

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste tem 55 anos de idade,é solteira e mãe de 06 filhos dos quais  01 é que esta a estudar. Ela trabalha todo o dia vendendo productos alimentares básicos.
Ela precisa do empréstimo para comprar cebola, pimenta, palone epatas de galinhas para revender.
 Seu maior sonho é de terminar a sua casa de forma a melhorar as condicões de habitação dos seus filhos e netos.
 O seu desafio é de pagar escola do seu sobrinho que é orfão de pais.
texts.en:
Celeste is 55 years old and single. She has six children, one of whom studies. She works all day long selling basic foodstuffs.
She needs the loan in order to purchase onions, peppers, bologna and chicken feet for re-selling.
Her biggest dream is finishing her house so she can improve her children's and grandchildren's living conditions.
Her biggest challenge is paying for school fees for her nephew, who has lost his parents.

loans.use: to purchase onions, peppers, bologna and chicken feet.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Me llamo Joaquin, tengo 64 años soy casado, tengo 3 hijos y me dedico al comercio desde hace 35 años. Primero le ayudaba a mi hermana, pero después ella me vendió su plaza, y desde hace 35 años me hice independiente, mi esposa me ayuda en el negocio que esta dentro de un tianguis. Trabajamos de lunes a sábado. 
Voy a utilizar el préstamo para comprar cobertores, cortinas, y artículos de Navidad
En el negocio vendemos cortinas, cobertores, fundas para baño, artículos de cocina, toallas, blancos en general
Mis principales logros son comprar mi casa, darle educación de mis hijos y lograr una estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Joaquin is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story:

“My name is Joaquin.  I am 64 years old, married, and have three children.  I have been working in commerce for 35 years.  First, I helped my sister.  However, she later sold me her space.  I became independent 35 years ago.  My wife helps me in the business, which is in a market.  We work from Monday through Saturday.

I am going to use the loan to buy bedspreads, curtains, and Christmas items.  In the business we sell curtains, bedspreads, covers for the bathroom, kitchen items, towels, and general bedding.

My main accomplishments are buying my house, giving my children an education, and achieving financial stability.”

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, curtains, and Christmas items.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a married woman coming from the village of Silano, in Zamboanga del Norte. She lives with her six children. 

To take care of her family's everyday needs, Rosalita was engaged in a buy and sell business selling charcoal in the market. As their needs are growing day by day, Rosalita must improve her business to more effectively meet the family's requirements. A loan of PHP 10,000 will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase grocery goods to restock her general store. She took a loan from GDMPC which she had recently joined. 

In the future, Rosalita wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to restock her general store.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Olinda tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 04 filhos que estão a estudar. Ela trabalha como professora numa Escola primaria perto de sua casa.
Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar cimento, area, pedra e ferros para a construção da sua casa.
 Seu maior sonho é de terminar a sua casa e  o ensino superior, porém tem o desafio de estudar mais de forma a terminar o curso dentro do período estabelecido
texts.en:
Olinda is 47 years old and married. She has four children who are students. She works as a teacher at an elementary school near her home.
She'll use the loan to purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron in order to build her house.
Her biggest dream is to finish her house and graduate from college. However, she faces the challenge is studying more so she can finish the course within the scheduled time frame.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie lives in the village of La Libertad in Zamboanga del Norte along with her husband and four children. She helps her husband in managing their farm to earn a living. As an aid to her husband's income, she plants vegetables in her garden. A loan from GDMPC will help Margie to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her new plot of green leafy vegetables. She dreams of expanding her farm to gain stable income for the good of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lustina

texts.en:
Lustina is 50, and married with six children. She lives in Colambutan, Settlement, Tudela, Philippines.

Lustina sells bananas and vegetables to earn a living, and has had this business for eight years. Lustina has been a member of PMPC for four years.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

In the future, Lustina hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old, married, and a resident of Don Jose Aguirre, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through fsh selling.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 11 months, and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative.

Now she is applying a loan of Php 10,000 for additional capital to purchase 10 "banyeras" (big basin) of fish to sell.

Elizabeth deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is helping her husband manage their own farm to earn a living. She plants and harvests vegetables and sells them in the market; she has been doing this for more than five years. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seeds. 

Mary Ann is hopeful of generating greater returns to use for the family's needs in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seeds

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina is 60 years old. She is married and lives at Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes care of and maintains a neighbor's farm. The harvest owners share in the profit upon sale, which is divided 10/100 or depending upon their agreement. With a desire to earn more, Florina decided to buy a piece of land for farming and takes care of it on her own as well.
 
Through PMPC, Florina obtained the capital to finance her farming activities. Now, she requests a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for farm labor for transplanting (pulling of seedlings, fertilizer application and planting). She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. 

Someday, she wants to buy an additional piece of land for farming to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor for transplanting (pulling of seedlings, fertilizer application and planting).

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in Dban Calamba Misamis Occidental. Leonila has engaged in the snack vending business and selling various groceries. She has been in this business for 23 years and earns a monthly income of 8,000 PHP. Leonila  requested a new loan to purchase stocks of raw goods for snack vending and additional groceries for her customers. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. She believes that her business is good enough to sustain their needs.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell and various groceries.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen lives in a home made of mud walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof in Maganda village in Mulundu, Kenya. She is 44 years old, makes her living as a subsistence peasant maize farmer, and has 5 children aged 15 to 22. The community of Maganda village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Maganda’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Maganda, 25 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Hellen has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Florence, Mary, Samson and Joash.

Maganda village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Hellen believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Hellen’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:

Gimarakwa village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Phanice and the 25 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Phanice has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. She volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help her community stay as healthy as possible by reducing diarrheal illness. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Joyce, Sagina, Japheth, and Zebedayo.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Phanice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Bushugunga/Chamagoti’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Bushugunga/Chamagoti, 15 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Grace has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Hellen, Barnaba, John and Laban.

Bushugunga/Chamagoti village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Grace believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases, thus helping people to maintain good health and work without sickness. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Grace’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers.

Lunyenya village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a river, stream, or other flowing water source. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Harun and the 11 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Harun has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Harun volunteered to be the promoter because wants to bring change to the community by instilling knowledge in community members and he wants to improve community health so people will fall sick less often. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Rosemary, Rose and Pamela.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Harun’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers.

Joyce will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:

Naida is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living; she has been doing this for 15 years. Naida has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizer for her coconut plantation.

In the future, Naida hopes to save for emergencies and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer for her coconut plantation

loans.name: Jane's Group

Jane and other promoters in her community (including: Esther, Getwell, and Salome) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Jane will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Jane wants to be a promoter to help her people drink chlorinated water. Jane believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases by killing germs in the water.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Jane’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth earns her living in the farming business; she has been doing this for 38 years.

Elizabeth joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in April, 2013; she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000. This loan is intended to buy farm supplies such as hybrid seeds, farmers variety, fertilizer, and pesticides.

Elizabeth dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as hybrid seeds, farmers variety, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
In Mwembe village, Kenya, Esther has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Esther is a friendly, trustworthy, well-known, and well-liked subsistence peasant farmer with 8 children. She lives in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof.

Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Esther and the 10 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area.
