loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal was born in 1987. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is in the military. Amal has been selling clothes for one year. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her family financially. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Basam

texts.en: Basam is a 25-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. He has a grocery store and that is his main source of income. He started his business two years ago. His business was initially begun with limited capital that didn`t allow it to run well to get more profit. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a loan of 100,000 YER to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to stock his business with more products

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen was born in 1967. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a retired man. Yasmeen has been selling food products for five months. She started her project with a small quantity of them at her house. Then she opened her own mini-market. 

Now she wants to increase the amount of food products she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her husband and children. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock her mini-market with food products

loans.name: Rajabi

texts.ru:
Этой женщине 39 лет. Ее зовут Рачаби. Она с двумя сыновьями живет в районе Хамадони. Рачаби в своей жизни пережила и счастье и горе. Несколько лет назад Рачаби развелась с мужем, имея двух детей и сейчас она одна воспитывает и обеспечивает их. Рачаби до этого времени продавала детскую одежду прямо на улице или возила свой товар в другие районы и села.
    Сейчас ее дети подросли, и Рачаби хочет больше времени проводить с ними. Ее сыновьям по 14 и 10 лет. Они уже в таком возрасте когда необходимо больше внимания и контроля. Рачаби хочет заниматься шитьем женской национальной одежды у себя дома. В данный момент она уже заканчивает курсы кройки и шитья, а после приобретения швейной машинки собирается самостоятельно принимать заказы на шитьё. Рачаби будет предоставлять женщинам района услуги швеи. Поэтому она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку.
texts.en:
The borrower is a 39-year-old woman named Rajabi. She lives with her two sons in the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan and has experienced both happiness and sorrow in her life.  A few years ago, Rajabi divorced from her husband and was left alone to raise and provide for her two children.  Before her divorce, she used to sell children's clothes on the street and also went to other districts and villages to sell her merchandise. 

Rajabi's children are getting older -- they are now 14 and 10 years old.  Rajabi wants to spend more time with them because they are at an age where they need more attention and supervision.  Rajabi would like to start sewing traditional Tajik outfits for women from her home.  At the moment, she is finishing a course in cutting and sewing, and once she has purchased a sewing machine, she is planning to take her own orders and offer sewing services to the women of her district.  

Rajabi is taking a loan to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine in order to launch her own sewing business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with seven children. She is 61 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Maria is a retailer of bags, cosmetic products and fashion jewelries to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional products.

Maria has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for six years. In the future, Maria hopes to save more and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like bags, etc.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is 53 years old and a widowed woman living with her two children in Baray district of Kampong Thom province. She is involved in selling natural medicine door-to-door to generate daily income. She doesn't make the medicines on her own, but she just brings them from her suppliers and retails directly to clients. Man’s daughter helps cover the family’s expenses by tailoring clothes. 

Since they are experiencing difficulties in their transportation needs, Man decided to take out a loan of $800 to buy a motorcycle to serve the entire family for their transportation needs. This purchase will help reduce unwanted expenses they pay for taxis. In the future, Man aims to save enough to sustain her business and educate her youngest child until the high school level.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to serve the entire family for their transportation needs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 65 years old and lives in Gango Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Lydia  has a business which is buying and selling. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. Lydia has  requested a loan to purchase additional products such as pillows and blankets.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Lydia would like to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to buy goods like pillows and blankets.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has a hardware business that she has been running for the last 15 years, and it has been profitable. She is 46 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with four children.

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the loan amount to buy cement and iron sheets to sell. This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers as well as make more profit. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Eunice repaid her previous loan successfully. In the future, Eunice hopes to open another hardware business.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets to sell

loans.name: Las Delicias - 31 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS DELICIAS – 31 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Verónica, tiene 33 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona Punata,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Verónica, va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada al por mayor como faldas y vestidos ya que se acerca la época de calor, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Verónica, enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar mercadería, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Verónica, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en: The business bank Las Delicias-31 is made up of eight members: six women and two men. The president of the bank, Veronica, is 33 years old and works in the sale of seasonal clothing. She sells her products at her sales stand which is found in the Punata area. This loan is her first sequence within the institution. Veronica is going to use this loan to buy seasonal clothing wholesale such as skirts and dresses, since the warm season is soon, and this season includes a lot of orders. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital. Veronica faces challenges in her business such as the daily competition. She will use the funds to buy merchandise. Her wish for her business is to have merchandise in stock so she can offer a variety of products to her customers. Veronica feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support given which lets her improve in her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Because Aisha is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Aisha was born in 1985. She is married and has four children. Aisha has been selling cereals since six months ago. She started her project with a small quantity of them. Now she wants to raise the amount of the cereals she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her husband and children. She also wants to buy a weighing machine for the cereals, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine for her business.

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en:
Neneta is 53 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

To earn a living, Neneta has a business selling vegetables in the local market. She earns about 8,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] each month doing this type of work. Neneta has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers including the inorganic and commercial types.
                                                                            
Neneta has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Neneta would like to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers including inorganic and commercial types.

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru:
Амине 38 лет. Она из города Худжанд. В этом городе она росла и живет со своей семьей до сих пор. Ее муж водитель, дочь и сын учатся в школе. Дочери 17 лет, сыну 12 лет. Амина любит детей и поэтому работает в детском саде воспитательницей. Больше всего в этой работе ей нравится то, что она проводит время в окружении маленьких детей. 
   Дополнительно Амина дает частные уроки детям до школьного возраста, у себя дома. Она преподает уроки русского языка, чтобы таджикским детям было легче учиться в русских школах. Амина просит кредит для приобретения ноутбука. Она хочет быть в курсе всех событий и научить детей современным способом.
texts.en:
Amina, age 38, is from the city of Khujand.  This is where she grew up and where she has always lived with her family.  Her husband is a driver, her daughter and son are still in school.  They are respectively 17 and 12 years old.  Amina loves children and works as a preschool teacher.  What she likes the most about her job is that she gets to spend her time surrounded by young children.  

In addition to her job, Amina also gives private lessons to preschool children, from her home.  She teaches Russian to Tajik children in order to make it easier for them to attend Russian schools.

Amina is taking a loan to buy a laptop.  She wants to stay in touch with current events and to teach her students using the newest teaching methods.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en: Baraa is 22 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her five siblings and her parents. Her mother is a retired woman. Baraa is studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration in her fourth year. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Willy con quien tiene una hija: Juana a la que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 25 años. Hace unos años atrás comenzó a abrir una tienda de comestibles a las afueras de la ciudad, esta idea le fue muy bien pues comenzó vendiendo y ganando muchos clientes, es así que pensó en la idea de expandir su negocio y mejorarlo para abrir un restaurante, además de mesas para poder vender bebidas heladas pues el calor de la selva es fuerte. Ahora tiene un espacio completo donde la mayor cantidad de ganancias los obtienen los fines de semana y las fechas festivas donde visitan del interior del país como también turistas del extranjero. Su proyecto es comprar mayor terrenos para poder brindar otras actividades turísticas.   Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables.Isabel, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para preparar los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, verduras, carnes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Isabel, 42, is a hardworking woman. She lives in the company of her husband with whom she has a daughter: Juana, who she cares for in the house that she inherited 25 years ago. A few years ago she opened a grocery store on the outskirts of the city. This idea went very well so she started selling and gaining many customers. That's how she got the idea to expand her business and improve it by opening a restaurant, besides food she would be able to sell cold drinks since the heat of the jungle is strong. Now she has a complete space where the majority of profits are earned on weekends and holidays when visitors come from the interior of the country, as well as foreign tourists. Her project is to buy a bigger lot to be able to offer other tourist activities. She belongs to the communal bank "La Brisas," and this is the third loan with KIVA. She is happy to continue working with the members of her communal bank who are very supportive, welcoming, and responsible. Isabel will invest the 2000 nuevo soles in the purchase of necessities for preparing the food such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, vegetables, and meats, among others. 

Isabel, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Willy con quien tiene una hija: Juana a la que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 25 años. Hace unos años atrás comenzó a abrir una tienda de comestibles a las afueras de la ciudad, esta idea le fue muy bien pues comenzó vendiendo y ganando muchos clientes, es así que pensó en la idea de expandir su negocio y mejorarlo para abrir un restaurante, además de mesas para poder vender bebidas heladas pues el calor de la selva es fuerte. Ahora tiene un espacio completo donde la mayor cantidad de ganancias los obtienen los fines de semana y las fechas festivas donde visitan del interior del país como también turistas del extranjero. Su proyecto es comprar mayor terrenos para poder brindar otras actividades turísticas.   Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables.Isabel, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para preparar los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, verduras, carnes, entre otros.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant such as vegetables, meats, noodles, among others.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 59 years old, married, and supports three members of her family.  She runs a cereals business in Kapsabet, Kenya that is served by the KADET Kapsabet field partner. The cereals business has been her source of income for the last fifteen years.  Jane earns an average monthly income of 30,000 KES.

She plans to use the borrowed amount of 100,000 KES to expand her business by adding stock of maize and beans of different types.  Jane will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.  Her dream is to buy land and build rental homes.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize and beans of different varieties.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is 63 years old and runs a water supply business in Kitengela, Kenya and its surrounding areas.  She is married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with 3 children.  Lonah has been in the water supply business for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. The business has been profitable.

Lonah plans to use this loan to buy water tanks and water pipes, which will allow her to supply more water to her customers.  She anticipates that she will earn more profit, which she will use to purchase additional water tanks.

This is Lonah's third loan term and she has repaid all previous loans successfully.  She hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy water tanks and pipes.

loans.name: Janechit

texts.en:
Janechit is 36 years old and lives in Purok 9 Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is married with 2 children. 

To earn a living, Janechit has a barbecue stall. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She is also in guso (seaweed) production where she earns 25,000 PHP each month. Janechit has requested a loan to buy kilos of meat for her barbecue stall as well as soft ties for her guso production and other materials.

Janechit has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Janechit would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like kilos of meat for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, where she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 23 years old, married, and supports three members of her family.  She operates a retail business in Kipsigak, Kenya, which is served by the KADET Kapsabet field office. Eunice has been in the retail business for the last three years and earns an average monthly income of 17,000 KES.  

Eunice plans to use the 30,000 KES borrowed to buy additional stock of cooking fat, wheat floor and sugar for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy stock for her business as well as make loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of cooking fat, wheat floor and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Настоящий художник должен стараться быть неповторимым. Шариф - художник из города Худжанд продемонстрировал свою неповторимость, рисуя на ковровом полотне людей, танцующих народные таджикские танцы, а также рисуя на бумаге красивые пейзажи и моменты. Настоящие ценители искусства могут различить работы художников, но работы Шарифа даже простой человек может отличить. Шарифу 58 лет. Он женат и живет в одном доме с женой, сыном, невесткой и тремя внуками. Всерьез он начал рисовать и демонстрировать свои творения 25 лет назад. Шариф все эти годы работает в колледже искусств. Одновременно у себя дома он предоставляет частные уроки по искусству рисования. Он хочет передать свое умение и мастерство молодому поколению и сейчас у него двое учеников.  
   В данный момент Шариф нуждается в кредите, у него закончились краски и нужно обновить запас кистей. Он на сумму от кредита собирается купить краски и кисти, чтобы не делать паузу в своей работе.
texts.en:
A real painter strives to be unique.  Sharif, an artist from the city of Khujand, demonstrates his uniqueness by using rugs as canvases and by painting people dancing traditional Tajik dances.  He also draws beautiful landscapes and still-lifes on paper.  While you need to be a true art lover to appreciate the work of some painters, Sharif's creations can also be enjoyed by people with little knowledge of art. 

Sharif is 58 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren.  He seriously began to draw and exhibit his work 25 years ago.  All these years, he has also been working at an art institute.  At the same time, he gives private art lessons at home.  He wants to pass on his talent and skills to the younger generation, and he currently has two students.

Sharif needs a loan because he has run out of paints and he needs to renew his stock of brushes.  He plans to use the amount of his loan to buy paints and brushes so that his work doesn't need to be interrupted.

loans.use: to buy brushes and paints.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a Cameroonian, aged 32 and married with two children. His older child is five years into primary school while his younger child is two years into nursery school. He has been in this tailoring business for the past seven years which makes him very experienced. His business is very stable, profitable and is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help him increase his turnover by 50 percent. His standard of living will improve as well.

loans.use: to buy tissue materials for sewing clothes and dresses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 35 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su pequeño hijo al que cuida con mucho amor en una casa alquilada. Desde las primeras horas del día se concentra para atender a sus clientes quienes conocen del buen gusto de sus platos de comida. Esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 5 años, ya es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de atención y el ambiente de su restaurante ya que depende mucho de ello poder recibir cada día más turistas. Ella quiere progresar pues el comienzo de su negocio fue muy difícil y ahora que tiene una estabilidad desea seguir mejorando. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables.
María, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos tales como verduras, carnes , fideos , entre otros.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She is a simple woman; she lives with her husband and their small son, for whom she cares with a lot of love in a rented house. 

From the early hours of the morning, she focuses on attending to her customers, who know the excellent flavor of her dishes. She has been doing this work for 5 years and is already well known in the area for being an unassuming and hardworking woman. 

Now, she desires to improve the quality of service and the ambiance of her restaurant, as she depends a great deal on these to receive more tourists every day. She wants to make progress, because starting her business was very difficult, and now she wants to have stability; she hopes to continue making improvements.

She belongs to the communal bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). This is the third loan with Kiva, and she is happy to continue working with the members of the communal bank, who are very supportive, welcoming and responsible.

María will invest the S/.1000 soles in the purchase of supplies for preparing her dishes, such as vegetables, meat, and noodles, among others.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, noodles, and meat, among others.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel, de 44 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Javier con quien tiene 2 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 7 años. Hace 3 años pensó en crear ingresos extras para su familia, es así que fue convencida en incursionar en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio es así que constantemente compra accesorios al por mayor, ya que de esa manera tiene un stock asegurado para cada mes, esto le permite a ella ganar hasta el doble por cada producto. Ahora se concentra en mejorar sus ventas para poder poner a vendedoras en toda la ciudad y así mejorar sus ingresos diarios. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el primer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Ysabel, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de productos de belleza al por mayor.
texts.en:
44-year-old Ysabel is a fighting woman. She lives with her husband Javier, with whom she has 2 children, who she raises in a house that she bought 7 years ago. 

3 years ago, she thought about making some extra income for her family. It was in this way that she was convinced to try selling beauty products by catalog. She says that it’s going very well for her in her business. So, she constantly buys wholesale accessories, because in this way, she has stock assured for each month. This allows her to earn up to double price for each product. Now, she is concentrating on improving her sales in order to be able to have saleswomen throughout the city, and in this way, improve her daily earnings. 

She belongs to the communal bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is happy to continue working with the members of her communal bank, who are very supportive, welcoming and responsible. 

Ysabel will invest the S/.1500 soles in the purchase of wholesale beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos quien aparece en la foto con su pareja y socia, es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Carlos tiene 26 años, vive en la Delegación de Tlalpan en la ciudad de México. Vive en unión libre con su pareja y no tiene hijos. Hace 5 años, decidió con su pareja iniciar un negocio de materias primas y abarrotes en el cual venden productos como chiles secos, moles, dulces, productos desechables, etc.
Quieren el crédito para comprar productos para su negocio, esta pensando en abrir un segundo local con el mismo giro. 
Carlos dice que inicio con muy poco pero gracias al esfuerzo ha logrado crecer su negocio y su meta es abrir otro local y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Carlos, who appears in the photo with his partner in business and in life, is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his  story.

Carlos is 26 years old and lives in the Tlalpan district of Mexico City. He is in a common-law relationship with his partner and has no children. Five years ago he and his partner decided to start a business selling ingredients and groceries, where they sell products such as dry chilies, sauces, candy and disposable products.

They want the loan so that they can buy products for their business, as he is thinking of opening a second shop in the same line.  Carlos says he started with very little, but thanks to his efforts he has managed to expand his business. His goal is to open another shop and to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy seeds, sauces, soft drinks and other products for his store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a very hard working man from Nyahururu. He is 31 years old, married to Julia and they are blessed with one child aged 4 years.

He is a shopkeeper, a business he has been running for the past seven years. Joseph has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd which will enable him to buy more stocks of umbrellas, handbags, sugar, flour, cooking fat, rice and other items to sell to his customers.

His monthly income right now is KES 50,000 and he has plans of expanding his business using the profits realized from his expanded business.

Joseph hopes and dreams of a brighter future both in his business and for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of umbrellas, handbags, sugar, flour, cooking fat, rice and other items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Malkia

texts.en:
Malkia is a married woman with two children, one in school and one underage. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women's wraps) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is from Metsamor village. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and 8-year-old granddaughter. Artyom is involved in a furniture-making business. He makes different types of furniture accessories and doors, and sells to local people. After five years of hard work, Artyom is currently facing high demand for the products he is making and has already gained a good client base. Locals value the quality and hard work that Artyom provides. Now to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for making furniture, Artyom has applied for this loan. Because of his family's increasing costs, Artyom has no saved money and that's the reason he has applied for the loan. 
Artyom has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Artyom and he will be very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for his furniture-making business

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Alan y sus 2 pequeñas hijas a las que cuida en la casa que compró hace 2 años. Hace apenas 4 años formó su familia, desde entonces ideó la manera de dedicarse a un negocio propio, pues su esposo trabaja en una mina y cada 20 días regresa a la casa. Este inconveniente la incentivó a  comenzar en la venta de comidas a base de pollo cada fin de semana. Posee ella misma una carpa muy grande donde realiza esta actividad a base de pollos dorados que promociona días anteriores a la venta. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y siempre le deja ganancias que le permite solventar algunas necesidades cuando su esposo no se encuentra, además del tiempo necesario para cuidar de sus niñas.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el primer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Edith, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de pollos por cantidad para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Edith, 27, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband Alan and looks after her two young children in the house that she bought two years ago.  She thought up the idea of starting her own business when she started her family four years ago.  Her husband works in a mine and only comes home every 20 days.  This difficult situation gave her the incentive to start selling a range of chicken based dishes every weekend.  She uses roast chickens and sells the meals, which she advertises a few days before, from under her own large marquee.  

She says that the business is going well and she always earns enough money to help buy necessary things when her husband is not around, while also allowing her the time she needs to look after her little girls.  

She belongs to the communal bank “Las brisas” and this is her first Kiva loan.  She is delighted to continue working with the other members of the communal bank because they are very supportive, welcoming and responsible.  

Edith will use the 1500 Peruvian soles to buy chickens in bulk to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married with two children. She is 27 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur. 

To earn a living, Emily has a junk shop. She had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. She is applying for a loan to purchase weighing scales  for her junk shop business. Emily has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to build a big shop to store the junk.

loans.use: to purchase weighing scales for her junk shop business

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en: Sherwin is married with one child and runs a service-based business, providing motorcycle transport services that carry passengers and baggage. He has been doing this for more than five years to earn a living. He joined GDMPC in 2010 and his previous loan was used in repairing the vehicle and was successfully repaid. Recently, Sherwin took a new loan to purchase tires and spare parts. He dreams that in the future, his child will finish school to have a better living.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en: Anna Mary is an ambitious married woman with three children living in Hoima, Uganda. She sells motor vehicle oil and has been in business for two years. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university level and to set up other income generating activities to secure their future. Price fluctuation and scarcity of fuel are her major challenges while her dream is to own a gas station in town. Anna Mary intends to use the loan to buy motor vehicle oil to sell.

loans.use: to stock motor vehicle oil.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 45-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is farming alongside dairy farming in order to boost her income. She is facing the challenge of price fluctuations. However, she has a vision of expanding her garden and having a health family. 

Florence needs a loan to buy tomato herbicides and weed her gardens.

loans.use: To buy tomato herbicides and weed her gardens.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 31 years old and a resident of Prey Veng province. He has a common-law relationship with his wife who has given birth to two children who are attending the local primary school. Tom owns and manages a one-hectare farmland on which he grows and harvests rice both for their sustenance and sales. Besides his farming tasks, Tom also helps his wife sell cosmetic products in the village and market. 

Since HKL provides a very special interest rate for water loan products, Tom was encouraged to borrow a loan in the amount of 500 US dollars to build a latrine for his household. He realizes that the loan may bring him and his family members good living conditions, and allow them to increase their personal hygiene. His future plan is to enlarge his areas for growing rice products and develop his retail store to satisfy the clients’ demands.

loans.use: to build a latrine for his household.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is married with eight children. She is 48 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City.

Melita is a laundry woman to earn a living and to support her family. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy materials for her house repair.

Melita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to save for future emergencies and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with two children. She is 23 years old and lives in Lower Bagong, Silang Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. 

To earn a living, Juliet has a junk shop. She has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. The loan she applied for will be used to purchase sacks and bags to contain the stock of her junk shop.

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to build a big shop to stock the junk.

loans.use: to purchase sacks and bags for her junk shop

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 28 years old, single and supports one member of her family. She operates a money transfer business commonly known as 'M-PESA'. This has been her income generating business for the last two years, getting an average monthly income of KES 20,000. She plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 30,000 to add float to her Mpesa business and open another Mpesa shop. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to add float to her mpesa business and open another mpesa shop

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
Nilsa es la tercera de 5 hermanos de la familia, sus padres viven y trabajan en la zona del Chaco, ella vino a la ciudad a estudiar en la Escuela Agrícola San Francisco de Cerrito, al graduarse, no quiso volver por sus ganas de superarse, con la ayuda de sus padres logró comprarse algunos productos para montar un pequeño negocio. 
Vive en alquiler en la casa de un amigo de sus padres donde tiene su Boca de Cobranzas de servicios y una pequeña bodega, estudia por la noche la carrera de Kinesiologa y Fisioterapeuta y quiere ser una persona profesional y seguir trabajando independientemente para ayudar a sus padres y sus otros hermanos, es una persona que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad y también para poder sus gastos de estudio. También agradece por la oportunidad de seguir creciendo que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Nilsa is the third of five siblings. Her parents live and work in the region of Chaco. She came to the city to study at Escuela Agrícola San Francisco de Cerrito and when she graduated she did not want to leave the city due to her desire to get ahead. With the help of her parents she managed to purchase some products to set up a small business.

She rents and lives in the house of one of her parents’ friends, in which she has her debt collection agency and small grocery store, and she studies Kinesiology and Physiotherapy at night. She wants to be a professional and continue working on her own in order to help her parents and her siblings; she is a person who wants to get ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in paying for her university fees and her study expenses. She is also grateful for the opportunity given to her to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and other study expenses

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es una persona muy sacrificada comenta que con mucho esfuerzo está estudiando, también comenta que su papa es una persona muy enferma y que su ama es quien ayuda mayormente en la casa, comenta que ella es quien lo inspira a poder salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y así está tratando de mejorar su futuro y el de su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide el de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su universidad y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, ya que así podrá seguir mejorando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a very selfless person. He says that he is putting a lot of effort into studying. He also says that his father is very ill and that his wife is the one who mostly helps at home. He says that she is the one who inspires him to get ahead in life.

He is studying business administration, thereby trying to improve his future and his family’s future. He is grateful for this opportunity, which will be a lot of help to him. 

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in paying his university fees and covering his transport expenses, so he can continue improving and growing.

loans.use: to pay his university fees and cover transport costs

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married with five children. She is 61 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City.

Emilia has a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month she earns PHP 30,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities.

Emilia has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Emilia hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is single. She is 27 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur. 

Jovelyn is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She requested a loan to buy more feed for her pigs

Jovelyn has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, she hopes to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pig

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es estudiante, trabaja también de forma independiente, cuenta que tiene una peluquería con buenos ingresos mensuales, es un muchacho muy trabajador, responsable se dedica mucho a sus estudios y desea salir adelante con sus esfuerzos para llegar a su meta. 
Está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma, y comenta que su sueño es tener un título Universitario y así poder ayudar a los agricultores a través del conocimiento que el adquirió estudiando esta carrera, ya que Paraguay tiene mucha riqueza en la tierra.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que hacer las gestiones de la titulación es caro y quiere poder cubrirlos.
texts.en:
Joel is a student and he is also self-employed. He says that he has a hair salon with good monthly revenue. He is a very hard-working and responsible young man. He puts a lot into his studies and wishes to get ahead with his efforts in order to arrive at his goal.

He is studying agronomy, and says that his dream is to have a university degree and thereby be able to help farmers with the knowledge he has acquired from his studies, since there is a lot of richness in the soil in Paraguay.

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in his graduation expenses, since the graduation process is expensive and he wants to be able to cover them.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani was born in 1981. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as an accountant. Tahani has been working at her small mini-market for one year. She started her project by selling a small quantity of food products at her house and she found her project a good source of income. Now she wants to increase the amount of food products she sells in order to raise her profit and income to provide good financial support for her husband and children. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her mini market

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is a young, single entrepreneur who manages her store selling snacks and longanisa (homemade sausage) in the market to earn a living. She always finds ways to earn an income in order to help her parents. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook and sell. She is hoping to improve the business and sustain it in order to have a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small house. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water heating system on solar energy and a tank for his home. By applying for this loan, the family will reduce their electricity use for heating water, especially in the winter. This will improve the family's living conditions. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water heating system on solar energy and a tank for his home

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es: Ynes, de 62 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Ynes es la compra y venta de ropa interior femenina de diversas modelos que están a la moda, los cuales trae a pedido, los distribuye entre sus vecinas y amistades, contando con muchos clientes.  Esta actividad la realiza de modo ambulatoria y con reparto a domicilio, lleva como 04 años en éste negocio, la cual lo realiza sola pero de manera muy alegre. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su actividad pues le genera un ingreso económico con el cual  tiene un sustento para la economía de su hogar, se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos. Ahora tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio. Este es el quinto préstamo con Kiva, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un préstamo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y así poder tener un buen record crediticio. Con el dinero solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de ropa interior femenina en diversos modelos y que están a la  moda, en mayor cantidad y menor precio y así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ynes, 62 years old, is a widow who lives with her two children in her own home. Her work is the buying and selling of various models of  fashionable feminine undergarments, which she purchases on orders and distributes among her neighbors and friends. She has many clients. She does not have a fixed location but moves from place to place, and delivers items to people's homes. She has had this business for about 4 years, and she works alone but quite happily. She considers her business a profitable one as she makes good money from it. She likes her work and it generates an income which financially supports her home. She feels happy about this as it brings her a lot of satisfaction and has gotten her out of many financial tight spots.

Right now she really wants to continue working and to be able to grow her business. This is her fifth loan with Kiva. She is very glad of the opportunity that has been given her to have a loan, and she commits to being punctual with her payments so she can have a good credit record. With the 1500 PEN that she requests, she will make a larger purchase of various models of fashionable feminine underthings.  A larger quantity is less expensive and so she will make a better profit.

loans.use: to buy ladies' undergarments

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en janvier 2011.Il est composé de membres issus du même village,elles ont comme activité le commerce,la restauration et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve au milieu et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 40 ans et mére d'un garçon.Son activité est la restauration.


Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour la restauration pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 1sac de riz pour une valeur de 12000f,10 l d'huile pour une valeur de 5500,10 kg de viande pour une valeur de 15000f,10kh de poisson pour une valeur de 5000f,des épices pour une valeur de 5000f et les reste pour acheter du lait en poudre et du nescafé.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne,assurer la scolarité de son fils.
texts.en:
This group was created in January 2011 and is made up of members who come from the same village. They have trading, restauration and farming activities.

The woman in the middle of the photo with her hand raised is in charge of the group. She is married, 40 years old and mother to one boy. She has a restauration business. She has good experience in this domain having practised it for several years.

With the loan she is planning to buy one sack of rice for 12,000 francs,10 liters of oil for 5,500 francs, 10kg of meat for 15,000 francs, 10kg of fish for 5,000 francs, spices for 5,000 francs, and with the rest of the money, she will buy powdered milk and Nescafé.

Her aim is to increase her savings and be able to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, fish, spices and milk.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis janvier 2011.Il est composé de membres issus du même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve en deuxiéme place en position assise à partir de la gauche,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 37 ans,est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Son activité est le commerce d'oignons,d'haricots et d'huile.Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec le financement,elle compte acheter 10 kg d'oignons,des haricots et de l'huile.

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: This group was created in January of 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same village and are small retailers.  The woman sitting second from the left in the picture is the group leader. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of 6 children, 3 of whom are boys. She has been selling onions, beans and oil for over 5 years. The plans to use her loan to buy 10 kilos of onions, beans and oil. her aim is to be able to cover her personal expenses and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, beans and oil.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Afin de renforcer son commerce de friperie commencé en 2005, Mr Komlan âgé de 23ans se bat chaque fois pour donner le meilleur de lui même. Il n'est pas marié et n'a pas d'enfant en charge. Le profit tiré de cette vente lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard une famille.
texts.en: The 23 year-old Komlan does his best every day to strengthen the second-hand clothing business he started in 2005. He is not married and has no dependent children. The profits he makes from his sales will allow him to buy more merchandise so that he can become a wholesaler and, later, start a family.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa vit avec son conjoint et ses 02 enfants à Lomé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré son activité de restaurant à domicile. C'est depuis 2005 qu'elle s'est lancée dans ce commerce et cela lui profite bien. Son second prêt sollicité à WAGES l'aidera à acheter des ingrédients pour son commerce. Elle espère assurer le développement de son activité et assurer la santé de la famille.
texts.en: Afiwa lives with her spouse and 2 children in Lomé. She started a restaurant business at home in order to be able to contribute to the family needs. She started her business in 2005 and it has been working well for her. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant. She hopes to be able to develop her business and cover her family's health care needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Âgée de 36ans, madame Ayoko a pour conjoint un architecte. Elle est revendeuse de profession et revend des produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2011 à domicile. Ses achats se font à Lomé et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Elle voudrait à l'avenir, développer son activité et prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en: Avoko is 36 years old and her spouse is an architect. She is a retailer and has been selling grocery products from her home since 2011. She gets her supplies in Lomé and is requesting her first loan in order to buy more merchandise. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.fr: Commerçante de pagnes depuis 2008, Valérie mariée à un gendarme est mère de 02 enfants(16 et 12ans) tous scolarisés. Elle revend à domicile et s'approvisionne dans les marchés extérieurs. Son premier prêt l'aidera à acheter de nouveaux motifs de pagnes. Le gain tiré de la vente l'aidera à ouvrir une boutique et bien assurer l'éducation de ses enfants. Elle est âgée de 38ans.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) since 2008, Valérie is married to a police officer and has 2 children, aged 16 and 12, who both attend school. She sells her products from her home and gets her supplies at external markets. This, her first loan, will enable her to buy pagnes with new designs. The profits she makes from her sales will allow her to open a shop and ensure that her children get a good education. She is 38 years old.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis janvier 2011.Il est composé de membres issus du même village,elles ont comme activité l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 55 ans,et mére de 10 enfants dont 02 filles.

Elle pratique l'élevage comme activité,elle posséde une expérience sure pour ce type d'activité car l'exerçant depuis sa jeunesse.

Avec le financement,elle compte acheter 03 brebis.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: This group was created in January 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same village and are either livestock breeders or retailers. The woman standing on the far right of the photo and raising her hand is the group leader. She is 55 years old and the mother of 10 children, 2 of whom are girls. She raises livestock and is very experienced in this area as she has been doing it since she was young. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 ewes. She aims to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy 3 ewes.

loans.name: Tiguidanke's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de Bantagnel est  Créé en   août 2011 le  jour de  son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont très engagées dans le développement de leur organisation,  toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont un esprit d’entre aide et de solidaire très remarquable.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Tiguidanké  (debout à extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de 02 filles et un garçon. Elle est commerçante, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans, elle a nouvellement ouvert une boutique dans sa maison où elle vend divers produits alimentaires partant du riz, de l’huile aux bonbons etc.  

En vue de préparer la Tabaski, elle compte   renforcer son stock de marchandises pour faire un bon chiffre d’affaire. 

Pour les bénéfices réalisés elle souhaite les utilisés dans la scolarisation de ses filles
texts.en:
This group was created in August of 2011, the same day as the "banc villageois" of Bantagnel. The female members are very involved in the development of their organisation, and all come from the same district. They like to support each other and have a remarkable solidarity. Their main business is small retail.

Tiguidanké (standing on the far right of the picture and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of 2 girls and a boy. She has been a retailer for over 5 years and recently opened a shop in her home, where she sells various grocery products from rice and oil to sweets. She would like to increase her inventory in order to prepare for the festival of Tabaski and post a good turnover. She plans to use the profits she makes to ensure her daughters' education.

loans.use: to strengthen her inventory.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de Bantagnel est  Créé en   août 2011 le  jour de  son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont très engagées dans le développement de leur organisation,  toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont un esprit d’entre aide et de solidaire très remarquable.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.
Madame  Kadiatou (debout à extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché kolda, elle achète le sac de mil fait les différentes étapes de lavage puis fait la transformation en farine à la machine du quartier, durant la matinée elle vend de la patte d’arachide et de l’huile  de palme toujours à la devanture de sa maison. 
. 
Avec ce prêt elle va acheter au moins 03 sacs mil, 01 sac de sucre et deux charrettes de bois.

Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront pour le tiers d’augmenter son épargne, une partie sera utilisée dans la scolarisation des enfants et le dernier tiers dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in August of 2011, the same day as the "banc villageois" of Bantagnel. Its female members are very involved in the development of their organisation, and they all come from the same district. They like to help each other and have a remarkable solidarity. Their main business is small retail.

Kadiatou (standing on the far right of the picture and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of 6 children, 4 of whom are girls and 2 of whom are boys. She sells vegetables at the Kolda market. She also buys millet, takes it through the various rinsing stages and then makes it into flour using the district's machine. In the afternoons, she sells peanut butter and palm oil in front of her home. She will use this loan to buy at least 3 bags of millet, 1 bag of sugar and 2 cartloads of firewood. Part of the profits generated by her business will be used to build her savings, part will be used to cover her children's education expenses and part will be used for the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of millet, 1 bag of sugar and 2 cartloads of firewood.

loans.name: Seynabou Kal's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution et de quelles que nouvelles adhésions, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Seynabou  (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main gauche levée), est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché centrale de kolda .
    
Pour ce nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner uniquement au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé en légumes.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire constituer une épargne assez importante en vue de bénéficier d’un crédit beaucoup plus important pour agrandir son commerce et mieux prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on November 15th 2006, on the same day as the inauguration of the "banc villageois" of Kambeng Doumassou. It is made up of women who are very familiar with the institution's program and of new members. The latter are very active with their businesses, notably small retail. They all live in the same district and enjoy good relations and a group solidarity which is very much appreciated.

Seynabou (standing on the far right of the picture and raising her left hand) is the group's featured borrower. She sells vegetables at the central market of Kolda. She plans to use this new loan to get her supplies of vegetables exclusively from the weekly market in Diaobé. She wants to use the profits she makes to build up more substantial savings in order to be able to ask for a much bigger loan, so that she can expand her business and is better able to take care of her children.

loans.use: to get supplies of vegetables at the weekly Diaobé market.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame BINTA (debout, en médaillon à l’extrême droite),  est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est un  leader très respecté dans le banc villageois,  elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter trois bidons de 20 litres à 15 000 FCFA l’unité.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne et les frais de gestion de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kambeng Doumassou Group was established on November 15, 2006, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. This group is made up of women having a lot of experience with the institution's program.

They are very active in their money-earning businesses, in particular small retail. They all live in the same neighborhood, which favors good understanding and solidarity among the group's members. 

Mrs. Binta is the group's featured borrower. She's the one standing on the far right in the photograph. She's a leader who's very respected in the Banc Villageois, and she sells palm oil.

Her new loan will enable her to buy three cans of 20 liters of palm oil, costing XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30) a piece. With her profits, she intends to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy three cans of 20 liters of palm oil

loans.name: Fatou Diop's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée)  est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est mère de 04enfants dont 01fille, elle  est âgée de 31 ans. Très rigoureuse et volontaire à la tâche elle  vend des produits de beauté à  savoir lait corporel et parfum de corps  qu’elle achète auprès de fournisseurs  pour la revente en détail au comptant ou à crédit.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock  par l’achat de douzaines de lait corporel et de parfum de corps et de chambre.

Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront d’assister ses enfants à bas âge dans leur scolarité
texts.en:
The Kambeng Doumassou Group was established on November 15, 2006, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. This group is made up of women having a lot of experience with the institution's program.

They are very active in their money-earning businesses, in particular small retail. They all live in the same neighborhood, which favors good understanding and solidarity among the group's members.

Mrs. Fatou is the group's featured borrower. She's the one standing on the far right and raising her left hand in the photograph. She's 35 years old and the mother of four children, including one girl. Very rigorous and proactive at work, she sells cosmetics, such as body milk and body perfume. She gets her supplies from wholesalers, and retails for cash and on credit.

She intends to user her new loan to replenish her stock by buying dozens of body milks, body perfumes, and air freshers. The profits generated by her business will enable her to support her young children's education.

loans.use: to buy body milk, body perfume, and air freshener

loans.name: Yousri

texts.en:
Yousri is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives with his wife and three sons in a small house. Yousri is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Yousri would like to improve his family's living conditions by buying all the needed items. 

Yousri took a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy a solar water-heating system and a tank for his home. By applying for this loan, the family will reduce their use of electricity for heating water, especially in the winter. This will improve the family's living conditions. Yousri appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water-heating system and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar water-heating system for her home.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda was born in 1977. She is divorced and lives in a rented house in a section of Jordan called Wihdat. Linda has been working as a party photographer and DJ for the past 13 years. She considers her work as one of her hobbies and a good source of income to support her as she lives alone and depends on herself. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying more cameras and DJ machines to be more productive and to earn better profits. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has asked for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more cameras and DJ machines.

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.es:
Aparicia de 51 años,  no estudio, está acompañada;  su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura con ellos solamente viven tres de los seis hijos que han procreado,  quienes trabajan para su familia, con ellos vive un nieto que depende de  ellos económicamente.

Le ayuda a su compañero de vida en la agricultura,  siempre se ha dedicado a lo mismo, es el tipo de trabajo que se da en la zona.  El trabajo ella lo aprendió de sus padres, él le enseño también hacer petates , ya que en el  cantón es una de las más importantes fuentes de ingresos, los petates los hace en su casa y los vende en el pueblo más cercano, para llegar a  la milpa ella y su compañero se desplazan a pie.


Necesita el dinero para pagar los mozos para  sacar el  maíz, el frijol  y pagar el trasporte de la cosecha.  Esto lo pretende hacer en un corto tiempo, lo que hará que su cosecha no se eche a perder.


Piensa en mejorar su casa, para que sus hijos mejoren sus condiciones económicas ya que el préstamo le ayudara para tener materia prima para su trabajo y así aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Aparicia is 51 years old. She didn't go to school and she is in a common law marriage. Her life's companion works in farming and only three of their six children, who work for the family. A grandson lives with them and is dependent on them.  

She helps her life's companion in the farming. She has always done this work and that is the type of work that is done in that area. She learned this work from her parents. He also taught her to make backpacks, since in that canton it is one of the most important sources of income. She makes the backpacks in her house and sells them in the closest town. To get to the corn, she and her life's companion walk there. 


She needs the money to pay the workers to harvest the corn and the beans and to pay for the transport of the harvest. She intends on doing this in a short time which will keep her harvest from being wasted.

She plans on improving her home so that her children can improve their financial condition. The loan will help her to have raw materials for her job and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest the corn, and the beans and to pay for the transportation of the harvest. She plans on doing this in a short time, which will keep her harvest from being wasted.

loans.name: Nelly Kati

texts.es: Nelly tiene 39 años es conviviente con 02 hijos educando hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de menú el cual los expende a los obreros civiles. En las tardes se dedica al cuidado de adultos mayores. Los días sábados prepara polladas chuletadas. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres: arroz, aceite papas y carne. La nueva meta a futuro de Nelly es tener un restaurant en donde pueda ofrecer sus menús. Nelly agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: Nelly is 39 years old. She is in a common law marriage and is raising 2 children. For 6 years, she has sold meals to public construction workers. In the afternoon, she works caring for the elderly. On Saturdays she makes polladas chuletadas. She will invest the loan in buying food: rice, oil, potatoes and meat. Nelly's new goal for the future is to have a restaurant where she can offer her meals. Nelly is grateful to the KIVA investors for the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, potatoes, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es vendedora de Salón, y está cursando el Ultimo año de la carrera Administración de Empresas. 
Ella pidió este préstamo para poder invertirlo en los gastos de Tesis, Cuenta que para ella es un desafío muy grande llevar ambas cosas, es decir estudiar y trabajar, pero el esfuerzo a la larga tiene sus frutos. Desea convertirse en una profesional exitosa, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su conocimiento.
texts.en:
Carmen is from the city of Curuguaty.  She is studying and working at the same time.  She works as a sales person and is in her final year studying business management.

Carmen has asked for this loan in order to cover the costs of her dissertation.  She tells us that working and studying at the same time is a big challenge but, in the long term, it will have its rewards.  Carmen wants to become a successful professional who can help other people through what she has learned.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her dissertation.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, de 40 años, es una luchadora mujer que a día a día labora para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada a la afueras de la ciudad. Ella, evita hablar de la situación difícil que vivió con el padre de sus hijos. Pero rescata que aprendió a valorarse aún más, por eso es una mujer emprendedora. Comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de cerveza y bebidas gasificadas, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos; además prepara comida para vender en su resiente recreo turístico “La Inolvidable”, asimismo cría decenas de patos y gallinas que enseba para vender y preparar sus potajes, pues le gusta disfrutar de los animales, Daniela, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, por eso el negocio le resulta rentable pues no tiene que pagar a terceras personas, su espíritu emprendedor ahora hace que piense en instalar una granja grande para que pueda vender al por mayor, ya hace poco obtuvo buenas ganancias con la venta de decenas de cuyes que compro a una negociante de la ciudad de Huancayo, orgullosa cuenta “críe 120 gallinas, las hice crecer desde muy tiernas y las comercialicé cada una a 35 soles, por so .estoy segura que este negocio me resultará muy beneficioso”.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Daniela, compra constantemente mercadería para su negocio, por ello con los S/.1000 soles que solicita, comprará los insumos necesarios para que prepare comida, además de cerveza, bebidas gasificadas y algunos dulces
texts.en: Daniela is 40 years old. She is a fighter who works day to day to get her family ahead. She is the single mother of  5 children and lives with 4 of them in her own house located outside of town. She avoids talking about the difficult situation with the father of her children, but she says that she learned to value herself more. That is why she is an enterprising woman. She started to sell beer and sodas in order to get her children ahead. She also prepares meals to sell in her new tourism restaurant “La Inolvidable”. She also raises dozens of chickens and ducks that she fattens up to sell and and to make her stews, because she likes to enjoy her animals. Daniela says that she has her children's help and that is why the business is profitable because she doesn't have to pay third parties. Her enterprising spirit is now making her plan on putting in a bigger barn so she can sell wholesale, since recently she made a good profit selling dozens of guinea pigs that she bought from a merchant in the city of Huancayo. She says proudly “I raised 120 hens from when they were very small and I sold them all at once for 35 soles. That is why I am sure that this business will be beneficial." She belongs to the “Las Brisas” communal bank, and this is her third loan with KIVA. She is happy to be working with her communal bank who are very supportive, kind and responsible people.   Daniela constantly buys merchandise for her business. That is why, with the S/.1000 soles she is asking for she will buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her food, as well as beer, sodas and some sweets.

loans.use: to buy sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (bags, rice sacks, and more).

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 36 años, está casada con Josue y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia hecha de madera. Esther se dedica a la venta de diversos insumos para reparación de vehículo y un taller de servicio automotriz. Fue una decisión según comenta muy planificada puesto que su pareja se desempeñaba anteriormente a trabajar como personal de apoyo en un taller de su localidad y tenia desde siempre el objetivo de  independizarse esperando mejorar sus ingresos económicos a largo plazo. Llevan casi 15 años con el negocio y con los años han logrado consolidarlo como un buen sustento para el desarrollo de su economía familiar ya que ella se encarga de administrar la tienda que expende diversos insumos para la reparación como aceites y repuestos mientras que su esposo brinda el servicio técnico correspondiente. Constantemente busca surtir su negocio con una mayor variedad de productos entre marca y precios para convertirse en una buena opción entre los propietarios y conductores de vehículos que visitan su taller constantemente. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos al por mayor lubricantes y aceites de una reconocida marca que es muy solicitada por sus clientela.
texts.en: Esther is 36 years old and married to Josue.  She has three children, who live at home in a wooden house.  Esther makes a living selling different supplies for maintaining vehicles, and has a garage.  Esther tells us that starting this business was a planned decision.  Her husband previously worked as an assistant at a local garage and he had always wanted to become independent and hoped to increase his long-term income.  The couple has had the business for 15 years and, over the years, they have developed a way to support the family economy. Esther manages the business, selling various supplies, such as oils and spare parts, for repairing vehicles, while her husband is a mechanic.  Esther is constantly looking to stock up the business with a greater variety of products, with different brands and prices, so as to offer a good selection to vehicle owners and drivers who are constantly visiting the shop.  This is Esther's second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead.  Esther promises to make her repayments on time.  On this occasion Esther is applying for 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy spare parts in bulk, and to buy lubricants and oils in certain brands that are popular with customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants for vehicles.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Walaa is a 26-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and one daughter. Walaa's husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Walaa and her husband would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Walaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy for her home. By applying for this loan, the family will reduce their use of electricity for heating water especially in the winter. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy for her home

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en: Faysal is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and his daughter in a small house. Faysal is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Faysal would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Faysal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy and a tank for his home. By applying this loan, the family will reduce their use of  electricity for heating water especially in the winter. This will improve the family 's living conditions. Faysal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy and a tank for his home

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla was born in 1992. She lives with her 3 siblings and her parents at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Khawla has been selling clothes for 1 year. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. Now she wants to raise the amount of the clothes she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her family. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy for his home

loans.name: Rawhi

texts.en: Rawhi is a 50-yea old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small house. Rawhi is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Rawhi completed building his new home recently and he spent all of his savings on it. He would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Rawhi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. This will improve the family's living conditions. Rawhi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home

loans.name: Artur
