texts.en: Marilyn is 32 years old and a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her two children, aged 11 and 9 years old respectively.  They are both in school.  Marilyn has been making a living selling perfumes, lotions, creams, and shoes for some years and runs the business out of her home.  With her profits, Marilyn is able to cover some household costs.  Marilyn is currently applying for a loan to buy merchandise in bulk, and to be able to stock up her business in order to earn higher profits.  With this she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, shoes, and more, in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is from Gyumri town, where she lives with her husband, her mother-in-law, and two school-aged children. Heghine has been teaching at a local school for six years. She is also providing overtime classes, at her house. Due to her hard work and nice attitude toward her children, Heghine has eight groups of children who are attending the supplemental classes that she provides.

Unfortunately, the living conditions of the family don't allow Heghine to provide appropriate conditions for her students. She needs this loan for purchasing chairs, a table, a printer and a scanner. These things will help her provide better conditions for her students. She has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important, to enable Heghine to purchase the products she needs and provide better learning conditions for her students.

loans.use: to pay for chairs, a table, a printer and a scanner, to use in providing education to children at her home

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 37 years old. He would like a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 31 years old. He is married, with two children. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 37 years old, and she lives in the West Point area.  She’s single, and she has four children who live at home and attend school. Bendu did not attend school herself.  

For the past two years she has been selling fish from a table in the local market. Her uncle gave her the money to start the business.
Her main challenge is the low sales of goods during the raining season. What she like about this business is selling to customers, and it makes her proud to send her children to school. 

Bendu has requested this loan to purchase more fish for her business. In the future, she would like to own her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Rubén Eliseo

texts.es:
Rubén de 32 años, estudio hasta bachillerato (nivel medio) en la ciudad, tenía que madrugar a las 5:00 a.m. para llegar hasta su destino. En ese tiempo él tenía  una relación formal, en  la que procreo un hijo que a esta fecha tiene 6 años y él está al pendiente, el niño cursa kinder. Rubén es el presidente de la adesco de su comunidad, desde hace 3 años,  es un buen líder,  muy emprendedor  trabaja con la agricultura, cultiva viveros  frutales y ornamentales.

De un periodo de un año, se dedica a comercializar hamacas (Jarcia) de seda, a la vez realiza trabajos de electricidad desde  hace 14 años, así como también a la agricultura y construcción de viveros. Su oficio comenta, fue aprendido de sus padres .Él se desempeña en varios oficios,  debido a que hay épocas en el año que algunos negocios son variables, pero a él esto le permite ser constante.. Los trabajos de electricidad los realiza dentro de su comunidad y lugares aledaños, en el caso de las hamacas las comercializa en las orillas de la carretera, para que los que transitan puedan  visualizar los productos que elabora. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  una caja de hilo de seda, para tejer hamacas, el resto lo invertirá en gastos personales. Él pretende disponer de  más variedad de productos, para los clientes y se acerca la navidad y es una buena temporada parar hacer negocios. 

Sueña que su negocio  de jarcia crezca, y así generar más fuentes de empleo para los pobladores, de su comunidad y esto permita el desarrollo de la misma. Al igual, desea tener más condiciones económicas que le permitan ayudar a su hijo en su formación académica.
texts.en:
Rubén, 32, finished high school in the city. He had to get up at 5:00 a.m. to reach his destination. At that time, he was in a formal relationship that produced a son, who is now six, in kindergarten, and depends on his father. Rubén has been president of his community's Adesco for three years and is a good leader. He works hard farming and growing fruit and ornamental plants. 

Besides farming and growing plants, he has been selling silk hammocks for a year and has been an electrician for 14 years. He says he learned the trade from his parents. He does a variety of jobs because some of these businesses are seasonal, but this strategy provides continuous work. He works as an electrician in his neighborhood and in surrounding areas. He sells hammocks at the side of the highway so that motorists can see the merchandise he makes. 

He has applied for a loan to buy a case of silk thread to weave hammocks and to pay personal expenses. He wants to have a variety of merchandise available to sell to customers during the upcoming holiday season, a good time for business. He hopes to grow his hammock business, which would create local jobs and allow him to develop personally. He also wants to improve his financial situation so that he can help his son get an education.

loans.use: to buy a case of silk thread to weave hammocks and to pay personal expenses.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 6 años que tiene su propio negocio de un taller de ebanistería donde elabora todo tipo de muebles de madera como ser camas, sillas, mesas, muebles de cocina, chineros, puertas etc. El ha mantenido su negocio mediante la inversión de préstamos. Actualmente solicita el tercer ciclo y es por  20,500 Lempiras con el cual va comprar madera para procesarla y elaborar muebles y asi poder tener un mejor inventario de madera y cumplir con sus encargos. El objetivo es llegar a tener mejor el taller y que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Luis is 39 years old and lives with his wife, with whom he has two children. They live in the Macuelizo municipality in Santa Bárbara.  Luis has had a carpentry business for six years and there he makes all sorts of wooden furniture: beds, seats, tables, kitchen units, cupboards, doors, and more.  Luis has managed to keep the business going by investing loans into it.  Luis is now applying for his third loan cycle, a loan of 20,500 Lempira, which he will use to buy wood to treat and produce furniture.  He will then have better stock and can fulfil his orders.  Luis's aims are to have a better workshop and for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre y para ella sus hijos son los más importante, es por ello que cada día Carmen trabaja con mucho esfuerzo como profesora, Carmen cree que le va viene n su trabajo porque es muy amable y sobre todo tiene paciencia con los niños.

Carmen esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá  terminar de construir su baño, ya que actualmente la vivienda donde habita no tiene este servicio, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the city of Guadalupe, she is a very hardworking woman, particularly as she is a mother and her children are the most important thing for her. That is why Carmen put a lot of effort into her work every day as a teacher. Carmen believes that it her job is going well as she is very friendly, and above all, she is patient with the children.

Carmen is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that she will be able to finish her bathroom, as the building in which she living doesn't have this amenity. In this manner she will be able to improve her family's quality of life and continue fighting to achieve her greatest dream; giving her children a profession.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is married, and has been in the farming business for the past seven years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer, in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Manuel Ormeño

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 36 años, vive en al calurosa y alegre ciudad de chincha y para poder salir adelante trabaja como ayudante en un pequeño puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado de su ciudad, Manuel trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Manuel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá completar el dinero para poder comprar un terreno y de esta manera poder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 36. He lives comfortably and happily in the city of Chincha. In order to get ahead he works as a helper in a small vegetable stall in the city market. Manuel works about 8 hours per day and thinks that it is going well for him in his work because he is responsible.
Manuel is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support he will be able to have enough money to be able to buy a plot of land. This way, he will be able to keep working and fighting to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Edis De Jesús

texts.es:
Edis de 31 años, estudio hasta séptimo grado (nivel básico),  es madre de un niño de 11 años de edad. Hace tres años se acompañó con su esposo y tiene dos niñas gemelas de un año y seis meses de edad, con quienes ha tenido que estar en tratamiento en el hospital de la capital, tiene que viajar durante cinco horas en bus para llegar al lugar, debido a unos problemas respiratorios de sus niñas.
Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería en pequeño. Actualmente, se dedica a cuidar de sus hijos, trabaja en la agricultura, especies menores y la ganadería, sus padres le enseñaron el oficio, el ganado lo posee cerca del hogar donde reside (tres vacas), ella los engorda o vende la leche y sus derivados como cuajada y crema. Además, vende leña y maíz en la comunidad.
El financiamiento que solicita lo necesita, para comprar una vaca, valorada en $600.00 y  el resto del dinero para pagar mano de obra en la recolección de las cosechas (maíz y frijoles). 
Sueña construir en el futuro su propia vivienda digna, para dejarles de herencia a sus hijos, las ganancias de las ventas las utilizará para en un corto plazo comprar otra vaca y así poco a poco ir aumentando su hato de ganado. Posee experiencia y le es un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Edis, 31, who left school after the seventh grade, has an 11-year old son.  She met her husband three years ago and they have twin daughters who are now 1 1/2-years old.  The twins have a respiratory condition and they have to be carried five hours by bus to the capital for treatment.  
Edis' husband has a farming and animal-rearing business.  Edis takes care of the family and helps with the farming business, as well.  She learned farming from her parents and now has three cows of her own.  She fattens the cows for market and sells the milk they produce.  She also uses the milk to make curds and cream.  As if all that weren't enough, she sells wood and maize, as well.
Edis will use $600 of the loan to buy another cow and the rest to pay for help harvesting her maize and bean crop.  
For the future, Edis wants to build a decent house, one that she can ultimately leave to her children.  She plans to use her earnings to buy more cows and build her herd bit by bit.  It's a good business and she has the experience to make it a success.

loans.use: to pay $600 for a cow and $200 for the help she needs to harvest her crop.

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is 50 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer, in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 33 years old. She is married with five children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production. She needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase production. She wishes to invest profits from her farming in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Fatima Carolina

texts.es: Fátima, es una madre soltera de 30 años de edad, desde que está sola ha buscado la manera de salir adelante, siendo sus dos hijos su mayor impulso para continuar, en la actualidad ellos tienen 8 y 12 años de edad, estudian primaria y secundaría, teniendo mucho camino por recorrer, el deseo de Fátima es que sean unos profesionales exitosos. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirle a su pequeño negocio de artículos variados como ropa, calzado, cosmeticos y prendas de bisuterías, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ventas para apoyar a sus hijos y mantener los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima is a single 30-year-old mother, since she became single, she has sought a way ahead in life, and it is her two children who are her main driving force. At this moment in time, her children are 8 and 12 years old, they are studying in primary and secondary school with a long path to follow. Fátima dreams that they will become successful business people. 

Fátima is seeking the loan to invest in her small business of varied products such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics and jewelry. Through this investment she hopes to improve her sales to support her children and cover the household costs.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Furaha, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children who are still going to school.  She has been running a beauty salon for five years, now. She works from 8.00 am to 9.00 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Furaha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more salon equipment, and especially the type which is in demand. She has paid back her first loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use her portion of this new loan to buy more salon equipment.  She dreams of opening another salon, in a different area.

Furaha will share this loan with her loan group, WEGA. The group has seven members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Mi Dios Todo Lo Puede 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Fabiola is one of the members of the group called Mi Dios Todo Lo Puede (God can do anything). They are twenty micro-business entrepreuners from San Pedro de Macoris, from a batey (a company town) surrounded by sugarcane fields where they live and work for their families. They are selling clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, groceries, food, etc.

Fabiola lives in a simple home with her family which is comprised of three members: her two children and herself. She started with Esperanza International because she needed capital to reinvest in a business. She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza International after having successfully paid off her previous loans and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around five years.

Fabiola is planning to invest her new loan in purchasing charcoal to sell in her community. She will also buy miscellaneous products like cosmetics and others things. She will run two different business activities -- miscellaneous product sales and charcoal sales. She said her most difficult challenge was to start her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha junto a sus 3 hijos y esposo, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabaja en un fundo hace más de 2 años, trabajo el cual lo realiza con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y responsabilidad.
Su mayor sueño es lograr que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales y logren todas sus metas.
Nancy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios de Kiva, ella utilizara el dinero en la compra de medicamentos para su esposo, ya que se encuentra delicado de salud.
texts.en:
Nancy, 31, lives in the city of Chincha with her husband and 3 children.  She has worked on a farm for 2 years, work that she has pursued with great tenacity and enthusiasm.  
Her greatest hope, she says, is that her children get paid work and succeed at whatever they want to do.  
Nancy's husband is ill and she is applying for a loan to pay for the medication he needs.  She wants Kiva lenders to know that she is grateful for your help.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Jimmy Alonso

texts.es:
Jimmy vive en la ciudad de Ica, tiene 23 años y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar los gastos de estudio ya que actualmente esta estudiando la carrera de Computación e informática.

Jimmy esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercedaria como polos, short, pantalones, enter otros para su negocio y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio y terminar su carrera”.
texts.en:
Jimmy lives in the city of Ica, is 23 years old, and works at his small business selling clothing.  Through his business, he is able to obtain income that helps him get ahead and more than anything pay for his school expenses.  He is currently studying computer science and information technology.

Jimmy is grateful for Kiva loans, since thanks to the help that he receives he can buy merchandise such as shirts, shorts, pants, and other items for his business.  In this way, he will be able to improve his income and continue striving towards his dream of having his own store and completing his degree.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his clothing sales business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 24 years old. He is single. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer, in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Santos Félix

texts.es:
Santos de 45 años, estudio hasta 6to grado en la escuela de su municipio, procede de una familia humilde conformada por 5 hermanos, de los cuales ella es la última, creció junto a sus padres realizando trabajos agrícolas y a la venta de especies (achote, ajos, canela, pimientas y otros). Desde los 16 años de edad, ella inicio la comercialización  de estos productos, aprendió de sus hermanos y  de un primo. Se casó a sus 20 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, 2 de ellos viven junto a ella y se dedican a la agricultura,  otro de ellos se fue a trabajar a la capital, otro vive y trabaja en la ciudad y otra  de ellas vive en la misma comunidad junto a su compañero de vida .Su ultimo hijo decidió emigrar hacia estados unidos, desde hace dos meses. Su esposo,  también se encuentra residiendo en estados unidos desde ya hace varios años y siempre se mantienen en comunicación y brindándoles apoyo para  sacar adelante a la familia.


El crédito será invertido, en la compra de materiales teja, vigas y madera, para el mejoramiento de una recamara, otra parte del financiamiento será para cambiar el techo de los baños, pues ya se encuentran bastante deteriorado, también cancelara el pago de mano de obra. Al hacer estos mejoramientos, tendrá una habitación más cómoda para la familia y los baños estarán mas privados.

Santos sueña con seguir ampliando su vivienda y poner ladrillo en el piso, pues actualmente es de tierra y  tener una vivienda mas amplia, cómoda y digna para ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, age 45, was in school in her municipality until grade six. She is from a humble family and has four siblings; she is the youngest. Growing up, her parents were farm workers and sold spices (achote, garlic, cinnamon, peppers, and others). She started selling these products at the age of 16. She learned to do it from her siblings and a cousin. She got married at the age of 20 and has five children, two of whom live with her. She and her two children work in agriculture. One of her sons went to work in the capital, another lives and works in the city, and a daughter lives in the same community with her spouse. Santos' youngest son decided to immigrate to the US a few months ago. Her husband has also lived in the US for several years. They are always in touch and he supports them.
She will invest this loan in the purchase of materials- tile, beams, and wood-to improve a room. Another part of the loan is for the repair of a roof over the bathrooms, because it is in very bad condition. She will also pay the labourers. In making these improvements, she will have a more comforable home for her family and the bathrooms will be more private.
Santos' dream is to continue expanding her home and put in flooring. The floor is currently dirt. She wants to have a larger, more comfortable and dignified home for herself and her entire family.

loans.use: to buy tile, beams, and wood to improve a room, and to change the deteriorated roof in the bathrooms. She will also pay the labourers.

loans.name: Sainjargal

texts.en: Sainjargal, 30 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as sales manager in Ulaanbaatar. Winter is coming to Mongolia and he wants to install a low pressure heater into his house for heating it. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy this. After installing the heater, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to install a low pressure heater into his house.

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en: Gankhuyag, 47 years old, lives with his son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2012, he has been rendering taxi service to local people. Before this, he had provided welding and automobile repair service for a living. Now, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, he and his son will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: Doña Argentina, es una señora muy trabadora que vende productos perecederos como frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, hace poco fue víctima de robo, ya que en la zona donde habita hay mucha presencia de  delincuentes, le robaron su caballo, el cual es su único medio de transporte junto a su carretón. Argentina es soltera y busca la manera de salir adelante, ahora solicita el crédito para poder comprarse el caballo con el que trabaja actualmente, el cual esta alquilando y el consumo de alquiler le desequilibra sus gastos diarios.
texts.en: Doña Argentina is a very hard-working woman who sells perishable items like fruits and vegetables door-to-door. She was recently the victim of a robbery; there is a lot of crime in her neighbourhood. They stole her horse, which was her only means of transportation, and her cart. Argentina is single and looking for a way to get ahead. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the horse she is currently renting. The rent is upsetting her budget.

loans.use: to buy a horse for transporting merchandise.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 68-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows bananas, cassava, and beans. He also earns a pension. Like most farmers, he is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes. His dreams are to become the leading farmer in the area. Thomas is requesting a loan to pay workers who are weeding and pruning his garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding and pruning his garden.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 39 years old. He is married with four children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Denys

texts.en:
Denys is 41 years old. He is married and has five children; they all attend school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer, in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old, married and lives in Pari-an, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines.To earn a living, she decided to raise pigs. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase piglets and feed. 

Ana is requesting another loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feeds and vitamins. She hopes that her business will grow and benefit her family. In the future, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with three children. She is 52 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Regina sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional goods to sell such as assorted breads, coffee, milk, vermicelli, peanuts, junk food, bananas, etc.

Regina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as assorted breads, coffee, milk, vermicelli, peanuts, junk food, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Jabu

texts.en:
This is Jabu. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase more bundles of fish for her business.  

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Miriam Yamileth

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Cortes. Hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir para niños como ser vestidos, blusas, short, ropa interior y pantalones. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 3,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales como telas para la elaboración de prendas de vestir. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is 33 years old, is a single mother of one son, and lives in the Cortes department of Honduras.  She has been making children's clothing for 2 years, including dresses, tops, shorts, underwear, and pants.

The loan that she is asking for is for 3,000 lempiras and she will invest it in buying supplies such as fabric to use for making clothes.  Her goal is to keep growing her business and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy fabric to make children's clothing.

loans.name: José Rogelio

texts.es:
José de 50 años, realizo sus estudios de primer grado, pero  no pudo continuar por falta de recursos económicos y se tuvo que dedicar a poyar a sus padres al trabajo de la agricultura. 

Él está acompañado,  ha procreado 4 hijos con su compañera de vida, sus edades oscilan entre 14, 12,6 y 4 años de edad,  3 de estos se encuentran realizando sus estudios en el  nivel básico en la escuelita de su comunidad. Él cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa. Pues  ella  hace ventas de antojitos tales como: yuca, enchiladas, pastelitos y otros. También, hace venta de cocteles de frutas y los vende a la entrada  de la escuelita de su misma comunidad. 

La agricultura es su trabajo principal, de donde obtiene el maíz y los frijoles. Además, realiza trabajos de albañilería, esto lo hace con  los proyectos que ejecuta la alcaldía de su municipalidad.

Actualmente, posee 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol,  esto lo hace para darle el sustento a sus hijos; así como los trabajos de albañil que realiza son con el mismo propósito. Se levanta desde muy temprano y sale de su casa a las 5 de la mañana y le demora 40 minutos  caminando, el poder llegar a al lugar donde realiza su jornada de trabajo en ocasiones sus hijos suelen acompañarle; pero debido a que asisten a la escuela son pocas las veces que lo hacen , pero cuenta con la ayuda de un hermano quien es el que le ayuda a realizar su trabajo.

Ssolicita el financiamiento con el propósito, de comprar materiales de la construcción tales como: arena, cemento, hierro y lamina. Para terminar la construcción de su casa, pues hace poco con mucho sacrificio logro adquirir  un terreno, es ahí donde construirá su vivienda,  pues por el momento él  y su familia viven donde su hermano.

Sus deseos son, seguir trabajando muy fuertemente, para tener las condiciones que le permitan hacer mejoras en la construcción de su vivienda,  como poner ladrillo en el piso.

El sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y sean unos profesionales de bien y al servicio de su comunidad.
texts.en:
José, 50, finished first grade but did not have the money to continue his education and had to help his parents farm. He and his life partner have four children, ages 14, 12, 6, and 4. Three of the children attend a small local school. He has help from his wife, who sells snacks such as yuca, enchiladas, and pastries. She also sells fruit drinks outside their local school. 

José's main work is growing corn and beans. He also works as a bricklayer for city projects authorized by the mayor's office. He has 10,500 square meters of corn and beans, with which he supports his children. Working as a bricklayer also meets this purpose. He gets up early and leaves his house at 5 a.m. He walks 40 minutes to his day job. Sometimes his children walk with him, but this is rare because they have to go to school. His brother, though, helps him with his work. 

He has applied for a loan to buy sand, cement, iron, and sheet steel to build his house. After much sacrifice, he was recently able to buy the land on which he will build the house. For now, he and his family live with his brother. He wants to keep working hard so that he can make improvements to the house such as laying brick floors. He dreams of seeing his children educated and becoming professionals who work for the good of the community.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, and sheet steel to build his house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Es docente de profesión pero con un gran espíritu de superación que no conforme con su labor educativa decidió haces más de unos añós decidió poner un negocio en el primer piso de la vivienda que habita un establecimiento dedicado a la venda de productos comestibles. Dentro de su negocio ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos tales como  azúcar, arroz y productos enlatados como la leche y conservas. Complementa su negocio con la venta de cremoladas preparadas a base de maíz morado y maracuyá  que tienen una buena demanda por habitar en una región tropical y además realiza la  venta de crédito para celulares. Esperando surtir constantemente su negocio acude a su entidad financiera para obtener un crédito financiero. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita a Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: Nancy, 33, is a single mother.  She and her 6-year old son live together in a house that she owns.  Nancy is a teacher by profession, but she started her own grocery business a few years ago after deciding that she couldn't meet her goals on a teacher's salary.  She opened the grocery in a space on the ground floor of her house.  She sells everyday products--sugar, rice, milk, etc.--along with cell-phone credits and drinks (called "cremoladas") that she makes herself.  This is a tropical region and demand for the maize- and maracuya-based drink is strong.  Nancy is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business.  The loan will be her second Kiva loan and she says that she is grateful for the support because it has helped her to get ahead.  She is committed, she says, to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  Nancy will use the S/.1,000 new soles loan to buy the products she needs--rice, sugar, pasta, milk--to stock her business.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Nyamragchaa

texts.en: Nyamragchaa, 24 years old, lives with his mother and two brothers in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a policeman at the department of the train station. His mother is an event organizer and works at a private firm. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation material such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: Gerelmaa, 41 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a barber at a beauty salon since 2011. Her husband is a building decorator and works for a private firm. Their two daughters go to high school. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 53-year-old single mother of five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 30 years she has been farming but also earning a salary as a teacher in order to support her family since the responsibility solely rests on her. With these proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and two of them have now graduated. Her dreams are to educate all her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and also to expand her farming activities by buying more land despite inadequate capital. Amina intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. She sells clothes, having started her business after realizing that farming was seasonal and could not help her in meeting the daily expenses of the family. Changing customer preferences, trends, and inadequate capital pose challenges to her business growth.

Mary is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy clothes to sell.  She hopes to become a model farmer in the area and also own a modern boutique.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, age 49, is from Bagacay, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married and is bravely raising 4 children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital for her pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs in order to sell them continuously. 

Wilma is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into snack vending. She presented her project proposal to PMPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000. She is thankful to PMPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase 2 piglets and buy assorted biscuits for snack vending.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel vive en la ciudad de Ica, es un hombre muy trabajador, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho como albañil y maestro constructor, el lleva en su pequeño negocio alrededor de 2 años y cree que le va bien porque es responsable y cuidadoso.

Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una pulidora, de esta manera podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para poder realizar su trabajo y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener una empresa constructora”.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the city of Ica. He is a very hard-working man. That’s why he is making an effort  as a bricklayer and general contractor every day. He has been working with his small business for 2 years and thinks that it's going well for himself because he is responsible and diligent. 

Miguel is thankful for the Kiva loans because the help provided will allow him to buy a floor sanding machine. This will give him the necessary tools to carry out his work and keep striving to make his dream of having a construction business come true.

loans.use: to buy a floor sanding machine (sander).

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is 25 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She did not attend school.  She’s married, and her husband is a driver. They have three children, who all live at home and attend school.

For the past one year, Princess has been involved in buying and selling candy and oranges. Her main challenge is the long distances she has to travel to buy the oranges. What she likes about this business is selling to customers, and it makes her proud that she is sending her children to school. She has requested this loan to purchase candy and oranges in bulk. In future, she would like to give her children somewhere nice to live.

loans.use: to purchase candy and oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Magiland

texts.en:
Magiland is a Cameroonian, aged forty. He is married and has five children. The oldest is sixteen and in secondary school, while the youngest is five and in primary school. 

Magiland has been in business for over a year now, which makes him experienced, and his business is profitable and stable. This loan will help him to increase his turnover by 20 percent. His standard of living will improve, as a result.

loans.use: to buy used shoes at wholesale, for retail sale at his business

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Mr. Byambadorj, 30 years old, lives with his pregnant wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a serviceman at a building company for one year. His wife will get to work next year. Now he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car for personal use. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. As his wife is about to give birth, the frequency of visiting the doctor will increase and transporting his wife safely to the hospital is the top priority for him.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mr. Batbayar is 52 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at an airline since 1988, and he is considered to be the best expert in his field. His wife has a position of administrative specialist. Their son got married and lives separately in a vacant house. So Batbayar is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy furniture, such as drawer, closet, sofa, and fridge, so that his son's family will live in a comfortable place where his grandchildren can grow happily.

loans.use: to buy furniture, such as drawer, closet, sofa, and fridge.

loans.name: Beath

texts.en:
Beath is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs the fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she hopes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 40 years old. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs the fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she hopes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 32 years old. He has been in the business for the past five years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is widowed with 4 children. She is 41 years old and lives in Taguima,Tudela, Philippines.

Elena is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers for her banana plantation.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Elena hopes to save for some future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 63 years old, married and a resident of Pari-an, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. Her husband is a pensioner. They have 1 adult child.  

Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of the Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from the financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last April 2013 and has taken out two loans. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her child finish his studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María auxiliadora, una jovencita de 25 años de edad, quien busca como superarse en la vida, ella estudio la carrera de Lic. en  contaduría pública y finanzas, actualmente labora en un banco en el área contable, muy contenta de ejercer su profesión, decide mejorar su perfil académico, estudiando cursos técnicos de ingles en turno sabatino y para facilitar la práctica del idioma vía internet, solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora, para el cual cuenta con una parte gracias a sus ahorros, esta inversión le facilitara para su conocimiento.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora, 25, is studying for an accounting degree.  She wants to get ahead in the world and already has a job in the accounting department of a local bank.  She is happy, she says, to be working at her profession and wants to continue improving her skills.  She is taking weekend classes to learn English and wants to buy a computer so that she can study the language online.  She has some of the money that she needs for the computer and is applying for a loan to pay for the rest.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Moise is married and has been in the business for the past fifteen years. He would like to use Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir is a young private entrepreneur from Kapan city in the Syuniq region. He lives with his mother, who works in the private sector. Vladimir runs a bakery, where different types of bread are baked and sold to other resellers. He and his mother work really hard to be able to earn a living. Vladimir's small business currently needs some investments. In order to increase the productivity of his bakery, Vladimir needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase a special blender machine for dough. With the introduction of this machine, the bakery will function more efficiently, which will help Vladimir develop his small business, increase his sales, and become more successful. Vladimir and his mother highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain and develop their small business.

loans.use: to purchase a special blender machine for dough

loans.name: Sakuntala

texts.en: Sakuntala is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is 32 years old. Sakuntala is a housewife & her husband is a farmer. The land where she is standing is used for growing turmeric. Turmeric cultivation is a very profitable business because it is used in many Indian dishes. The land is their own, so they will keep all profits from the turmeric sales.  They hope that with this money, they can cultivate more turmeric & later on they can also grow potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Khazhak

texts.en: Khazhak is an experienced farmer from Geghasar village in the Lori region. He lives with his wife, three sons (22, 21 and 1 years old), and his elderly mother. His middle son is a labor migrant worker in Russia; he works there and sends some money to the family to take care of their needs. With the help of his family members, Khazhak is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in the cultivation of wheat, barley, potato, and beets. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of their income. The cattle barn is currently in very poor condition and needs to be expanded a little bit and renovated. Khazhak needs a loan of USD 2,000 to renovate the barn. As this is Khazhak’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Khazhak and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to renovate the barn

loans.name: Rawsonara

texts.en: Rawsonara is a 50-year-old married woman and her husband is 61 years old. Rawsonara is illiterate and her husband completed class V (grade 5). Rawsonara is a housewife & her husband is a farmer. Rawsonara has three children and all of them are receiving an education. She lives in the small town of Dhupguri. Rawsonara has taken a loan from BJS of INR 15,000 so that they can grow more paddies in the field. For better quality rice, better fertilizer, pesticide etc are required. With this money, they will grow better quality rice to sell at the market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for rice paddy cultivation

loans.name: Graceous

texts.en:
Graceous is a married man, aged 50 years, with seven children all attending schools and universities. He lives in a rural area, deals in a retail shop business, and carries out agriculture and milk-selling as side incomes. He started his business in 2001. Graceous works seven days per week and 14 hours per day and he started his business to increase his family's income. 

He sells his products to local people from his village and he has acquired this loan in order to add stock to his retail shop and to be able to adequately service all his customers.

Graceous' dream is to build rentals on the plot he purchased some time back. He says his greatest challenge is delay of payments by his customers who take goods on credit. He describes himself as hard-working and he asks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited to continue expanding their services to rural areas, so that every person can access them.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 50 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  He is from the village of Etseri. His retired mother also lives with the family. Nikoloz runs small-scale agricultural business and breeds a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. He also grows grapes and makes wine. The cheese and wine are sold at the local open market. Nikoloz works hard to improve his earnings but they are still modest and hardly enough for covering food and daily costs. 

Nikoloz is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase chicks to start a poultry farm. He used to run this business but stopped due to financial problems. Part of the loan will be used to buy feed for the chicks. After several months, Nikoloz will sell the chickens for a good price and invest the funds in the next cycle. The family will have an additional source of income from the poultry farming, and they will be able to increase their daily spending.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm

loans.name: Lourdes Lili

texts.es: Lourdes, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Lourdes trabajo en un tiempo en una maquila y luego de quedar sin empleo estableció su propio negocio de venta de productos e la canasta básica como ser lácteos, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, churros, golosinas, etc. El negocio lo tiene desde hace 9 años y lo ha mantenido activo mediante varios prestamos.  El prestamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos de la canasta básica como carnes, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, arroz, pan, churros, refrescos, lácteos y otros, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 40 years old, is a single mother of 3 children, and lives in the Petoa municipality within the department of Santa Bárbara.  Lourdes used to work with machines but then found herself without work.  At that point, she started her own business selling basic groceries such as dairy products, sodas, meat, snacks, churros, candy, etc.

She has had her business for 9 years and has kept it going with the help of several loans.  The loan that she is asking for is for 21,000 lempiras.  She will use it to invest in buying more groceries such as meat, sugar, lard, beans, rice, bread, churros, soda, dairy products, and others.  In this way, she will increase her sales and help her business grow.

loans.use: buy basic grocery items such as meat, sugar, lard, beans, rice, bread, churros, soda, dairy products, and others.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en: Sahida is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is 42 years old and he sells wood in the market. Both of them are illiterate and just know how to sign their name. Sahida is a housewife. Her husband sells wood to people who use firewood for cooking. To sell wood, they need to purchase a tree & then cut it into pieces. Purchasing a good tree is expensive, so it was not possible for them to buy good quality wood. Sahida decided to take a loan from BJS for INR 8,000 so that they can purchase better quality wood & sell that in the market to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase wood to sell

loans.name: Estariki

texts.en:
Estariki is 40 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has spent 12 years in maize production. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 29 years old. She is married and lives at Pari-an, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she decided to raise pigs. 

Through PMPC, Leizel obtained the capital to purchase piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep conditions more sanitary.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is 57 years old. He is a father of six children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 64 years old and lives in Balintawak, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with seven children.

Alicia has a buy and sell business and earns approximately PHP 25,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan to buy 50 bags of rice to sell.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand from her rice buy and sell business into different products.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine, aged 31, has four children and she has been in the farming business for the past three years. She would like to use her Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Abita

texts.en:
Abita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000. This loan is intended to buy additional ingredients for ice cream making.
Abita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for ice cream making.

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
Jean D’amour is 41 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story. She is a responsible person who believes in fulfilling her commitments. In the past she has had other loans funded by kiva and she has never failed making her payments.  Rita is a 41 year old entrepreneur who has been a merchant most of her life. She lives in Mexico City in a neighborhood called Iztapalapa. She sells cosmetics, gifts and other products and some years ago she started providing taxi services. Today she has several taxis.  

Rita has requested a loan to purchase merchandise such as cosmetics, purses and perfumes. Also she will be able to fix the engine of one of her taxis.  With the loan she will be able to deliver orders to her costumers on time and also increase her sales. Her biggest accomplishment in life is being a regional leader in catalog sales, and her main challenge is to buy more taxis. She is an innovative woman who thinks that with passion and hard work nothing is impossible.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and gifts that she sells through a catalog, and to fix a taxi that provides her with an additional source of income.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Five years ago, Carlos decided to open his own construction business in Union City. Last year, his dream was realized and Carlos finally gained the permits and licensing to obtain his own contracts.

Carlos is already part of large network of contractors, having been working in the construction industry for 15 years. He is well known in the sector for having detailed work, and his good reputation allows Carlos to obtain contracts easily. 

Originally from Peru, Carlos manages four employees in the company. He and his wife are both entrepreneurial; she opened a restaurant this year and also provides jobs within the community. Together they are raising two children.

The nature of his work means Carlos gets paid quarterly. The funds from this loan will be used for working capital to pay for transportation, labor, and material costs for one of his projects. Carlos looks forward to growing the company and hiring more employees in the future.

loans.use: To pay for construction company’s transportation, labor, and material costs for one project

loans.name: Maria Orfelia

texts.es: María tiene 40 años, ella vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad muy comercial, se encuentra ubicada en una zona cálida húmeda del Ecuador, ciudad que ha crecido mucho en los últimos años porque es el puente entre las regiones costa y la sierra, tiene dos hijos, uno de 13 y una niña de 12, ellos estudian en colegio fiscal cerca de su casa. María hace 9 años por la necesidad y superación decidió crear por iniciativa propia su negocio. Ella compra chanchos en pie y vende su carne en un puestito ubicado en una vía principal de la ciudad, su negocio lo atiende cuatro días a la semana, los miércoles, viernes, sábados y domingos, desde las 7 am hasta la 1 pm. Uno de sus obstáculos fue cuando recién empezó  y se quedó sin capital de trabajo debido a que dejaba fiando el producto a sus clientes, luego no pudo recuperar el dinero, pero esta experiencia le sirvió de mucho para no volver  a hacerlo. Ahora gracias a los ingresos de su negocio poco a poco ha ido mejorando su vivienda e incluso adecuando cuartos para el arriendo. María conoció a Fundación Alternativa a través de vecinos quienes le recomendaron por los servicios que la institución ofrece, nos comenta que se siente muy agradecida porque ya lleva tres créditos y Fundación Alternativa le ha ayudado a mejorar mucho su calidad de vida, porque con estos créditos ella pudo mejorar sus ventas y mejorar su casa. Ahora el crédito que solicita es para comprar más cerdos pues en esta temporada la demanda crece y ella necesita abastecer las necesidades de sus clientes para así ganar una buena reputación en la ciudad.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, she lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a very commercial city found in a hot and humid area of Ecuador. It is a city which has grown a lot over the last few years because it is the bridge between the coastal regions and the mountain. 

María has two children, a 13-year-old boy and a 12-year-old girl, they study in the public school near her home. Nine years ago, through need and the desire to get ahead she decided to set up her business. She buys live pigs and sells the meat in a stall located in a main street of the city. She tends to the business four days a week: Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 7 am to 1 pm. One of the challenges she faced was when she had just set up and she was left with no working capital as she had left the product with her customers and was unable to recover the money later on. However, this experience was worthwhile in order to not repeat it. Now thank to her business' income, she has been improving her home little by little even fitting out rooms for rent.

María became aware of the Fundación Alternativa through neighbors who recommended it for the services that the institution offers. She tells us that she is very grateful as she has had three loans and the Fundación Alternativa has helped her very more improve her quality of life because she was able to improve her sales and improve her home through these loans. The loan that she is now seeking is to buy more pigs as in this season, demand grows and she needs to meet her customers' needs to therein gain a good reputation in the city.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village in the Mtskheta district. Merab works physically. He gets orders to repair houses and gets a small income. This is the only source of income for his family. As the income is not stable, Merab decided to start a poultry business. He purchased 200 chicks and wants money to build a shed for them. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. As the chicks are raised, Merab will sell the hens and expand his farm. The Start Up loan will be a great help to his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a shed for his poultry

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif is a 29-year-old man. He is single and lives with his family--his parents and his elder brother. For 20 years his family have been IDPs (internally displaced persons) from their native land, Füzuli. Now they live in the Baku region. His mother, Durdana, is a housewife, his father, Mahammad, has been in the butcher business for 18 years, and his elder brother, Famil, is a taxi driver. Vagif has been in the consulting business for three years. He has a small office. He wants to buy a notebook computer, as he needs it for his business when he goes to another place. A notebook computer will be more useful and comfortable. Therefore he applied to Komak for a loan of 400 AZN. Vagif is thankful to Komak and the Kiva organization for the help. His business and monthly income will be increase. In the future he wants to have a new employee.

loans.use: to buy a notebook computer for his consulting business.

loans.name: Edigard

texts.en:
Edigard is 56 years old. He is a father of eight and they all go to school. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, Edigard wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business.
