Rachael is requesting KSHS 45,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a young farmer from Arevatsag village of Lori region. She lives with her husband, one-year-old daughter, and elderly father-in-law. With the help of her family members, she is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, and hens and the cultivation of wheat, potatoes, and grass. Gohar's husband realizes the agricultural products in the local market. 

Agribusiness is the most important source of family's income. As the autumn is progressing, Gohar needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3,000 will support this young hard-working woman and her family greatly, enabling them to purchase some forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

With the help of the loan, the family will maintain and develop their agribusiness. Gohar and her family members highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is an experienced farmer from Vanadzor city of Lori region. She lives with her husband and school-aged son. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Ruzanna is engaged in cattle and pig breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of potatoes and apples. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

As the autumn is progressing, Ruzanna’s agricultural business needs some investments to continue developing in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase forage (hay and concentrated forage) for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it. However, thanks to their hard work in recent times, Ruzanna was able to run her farming business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So Ruzanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ruzanna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their farming business.

loans.use: to purchase forage (hay and concentrated forage) for their livestock

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.es:
Maria Rita es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Me llamo Rita y tengo 43 años, soy casada desde hace 24 años, tengo tres hijos y una nieta.
Me dedico a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 24 años. Me gustan las ventas y también me gusta bailar.
Solicitó el crédito para comprar mercancía de temporada ya que viene mi mejor epoca de ventas en el año. 
mi negocio es ventas por catalogo, como ya tengo 24 años vendiendo, mis clientes ya son todos conocidos y ellos me recomiendan con sus familiares y amigos , tengo una cartera de aproximadamente 100 clientes. Mis principales logro es haber ganado varios premios por tener ventas altas.
texts.en:
Maria Rita is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

My name is Rita and I am 43 years old. I have been married for 24 years and I have three children and one granddaughter. I have made a living selling cosmetics for 24 years. I like sales and I also like to dance.

I requested this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise as the best sales period of the year is coming up. My business is composed of catalog sales and as I have been making sales for 24 years, I know all of my customers and they recommend me to their friends and relatives. I have a portfolio of approximately 100 customers. My main achievement is having won several awards for high numbers of sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to equip the adult care facility with the proper furniture needed to operate.

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
Eldard is a married man, age 31 years, and with 4 children; three of whom attend different schools. He lives in a rural trading center with his family, and deals in agricultural produce business where he purchases coffee, beans, and maize. He also has a retail shop, which he considers as his side business, and he started his business in 2005.

He works 6 days in a week and 10 hours a day. He started this business to get money to cater for his family and improve his standard of living. He acquired this loan to purchase more produce for the business. He said that his clients are traders from Kyotera.

His dream is to enlarge his business and be the leading supplier of produce in his trading center. The challenges he faces are price fluctuations and lack of enough market for the produce. He describes himself as an honest man and encourages lenders to give clients the amount of money they apply for to enable them meet their targets.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce.

loans.name: Benonson

texts.en: Benonson, a married man, lives in a rural area with his family. He is an agriculturalist who does animal rearing and farming on a small scale. He needs a loan to buy baby goats that he will rear and later sell at an increased price. If he has enough money, he will acquire them cheaply, which is the reason he has requested the loan. He is optimistic that the business will make a lot of profits, and will eventually expand it to cattle. He is hard working and resilient. He is challenged by the dry seasons, and limited capital.

loans.use: to buy baby goats that he will rear and later sell at an increased price.

loans.name: Kyembare Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en: Kyembare Group consists only of women whose major activity is farming, a few of whom are engaged in cattle rearing They applied for loan of UGX 3,200,000. They will divide this money among themselves. They face a challenge of low productivity of their farming businesses due to poor farming methods, price fluctuations, and foot and mouth disease. Their prime target is to obtain high output from their plantings, to have more milk from their cows, and to take their children to better schools in the country. But they are short of capital and funds to enable them achieve their dreams. With this loan, they believe their production will improve and their life style will change in society. Jane will use her loan to buy seeds for planting. She is thankful for the financial support that Ugafode gives her group.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Soy Estela y soy casada, tengo 3 hijos de los cuales 2 viven aún conmigo.  Vivo en casa propia y tengo mi negocio de venta de ropa. 

Tengo mi puesto de ropa en un tianguis desde hace 6 años, en el cual tengo ropa para toda la familia. Quiero este préstamo para invertir en mi negocio y tener más variedad en la mercancía que ofrezco. 

Gracias a mi negocio he logrado sacar a mis hijos adelante, y mi reto es poder seguir adelante con él y hacerlo crecer más.
texts.en:
Estela is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

I am Estela and I am married and have 3 children, 2 of which still live sith me. I  live in my own home and I have a business selling clothing.

I have had my clothing stall, located in a street market, for 6 years. There I sell clothing for the whole family. I want this loan to invest in my business and have a greater variety of merchandise to offer. 

Thanks to my business I have been able to get my children ahead. My challenge is to continue to succeed with my business and make it grow more.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of clothing to offer more products

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Soy recién casado, estudiante de Odontología en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.  Me encuentro en la última etapa de mi carrera. 
Llevo dos años trabajando en un consultorio particular donde trabajo con un compañero; buscamos hacerlo crecer hasta formar una clínica dental. Aquí realizo odontología integral, operatoria dental, resina, amalgama, prótesis fija y removible, extracciones, cirugía bucal, endodoncias, ortopedia, coronas en acero, cromo y estéticas, etc.
Solicitó el crédito para poder ampliar mi consultorio, pensamos comprar otro sillón dental para que los dos podamos trabajar simultáneamente.
Entre mis logros están: haber sido el segundo mejor promedio de mi clase, haber pagado mi boda y amueblado mi casa.  Mi reto es tener una clínica dental con todas las especialidades.
texts.en:
Sergio is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

“I am recently married and a dentistry student at Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.  I am in the final stages of earning my degree.  I have been working at a private practice along with a partner.  We are looking to grow the business until it becomes a dental clinic.  I provide comprehensive dentistry, dental surgery, fillings (resins and amalgam), fixed and removable prosthetics, extractions, oral surgery, endodontics, orthopedics, crowns (steel and chrome), aesthetic procedures, and other services.  

I am requesting a loan so that I can expand my practice.  I plan to buy another dental chair so that my partner and I can work simultaneously.  Among my accomplishments are having the second best average in my class, being able to pay for my wedding, and furnishing my house.  My goal is to have a dental clinic that offers all specialties.”

loans.use: to buy a dental chair.

loans.name: Lucía Cipriana

texts.es:
Lucía es clienta de Kubo Financiera y esta es su historia:

Mi nombre es Lucia, vivo en unión libre desde hace 16 años y tengo hijos de 15, 12 y 10 años. Hace 8 años iniciamos mi esposo y yo este negocio en el cual hacemos uniformes principalmente además de blusas, entre otras prendas que nos piden.

Empezamos haciendo 5 uniformes y al ponerlos en venta empezaron a encargarnos más, luego ya eran 100 y así fue que decidimos ofrecer el servicio a varias escuelas y algunas tiendas de ropa. Tengo 2 empleadas en mi taller y damos a maquilar a 8 empleadas en Tula, Hidalgo. 

Este préstamo lo pido para comprar tela ya que tengo un pedido de blusas y para hacer algunos uniformes; me gusta ser buena pagadora y cuido mucho mis créditos para siempre tener las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Lucía is a client of Kubo Financiera and this is her story:

My name is Lucy. I have been in a common-law relationship for 16 years and have children ages 15, 12 and 10.  Eight years ago my husband and I started this business in which we mainly make uniforms, as well as blouses and other articles of clothing that we are asked for. 

We began making five uniforms, and when we put them on sale, people began to order more from us; then there were 100 and this was how we decided to offer this service to several schools and to some clothing stores. I have two employees in my workshop and contract out to eight employees in Tula, Hidalgo.

I am asking for this loan to buy fabric, as I have an order for blouses and for some uniforms. I like to pay on time and I'm very careful with my loans so that I can always stay in business.

loans.use: To buy fabric needed to fullfill orders

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia
Hola me llamo Marcela pero me gusta que me digan “Susu” y vivo en casa propia con mi hija que me ayuda en mi negocio cuando lo necesito.
Tengo 67 años, desde hace 15 años puse una tiendita que está ubicada en mi domicilio; ahí vendo abarrotes, refrescos y todo tipo de alimentos. Además vendo productos para la salud como vitaminas y suplementos alimenticios. 
Pido este préstamo para poder surtir más mi negocio y tener más mercancía que ofrecer, así como tener más productos de Omnilife y Lebasi para mis clientes.
Lo que he podido lograr con mi negocio es ir haciendo mejoras a mi casa, antes era de lámina y logre poner la loza. Quiero seguir mejorando mi casa y hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Marcela is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

“Hi, my name is Marcela, but I like to be called “Susu”.  I live in my own house with my daughter.  She helps me in my business when I need it.

I am 67 years old, and 15 years ago I set up a small store in my house.  I sell groceries, soft drinks, and all types of food.  I also sell health products like vitamins and food supplements.

I am requesting this loan in order to be able to stock my business more and to have more merchandise to sell.  This way I will have more products like Omnilife and Lebasi for my customers.

What I have been able to achieve with my business is to make improvements to my house.  Before there was metal sheeting, and I managed to put in the tile.  I want to continue improving my house and making my business grow.”

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and food stuffs to offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Hola me llamo Teresa tengo 50 años y estoy casada. Tengo dos hijos que ya son independientes, mi hija me apoya económicamente.
Me dedico a la fabricación de ropa interior para dama y caballero desde hace 20 años. Mis ventas son por mayoreo en un tianguis. 
Voy a utilizar el crédito para comprar tela en rollo, al comprar tela por mayoreo puedo obtener mayor ganancia. 
Tengo un taller de costura en la parte superior de mi casa. Mi negocio es familiar trabajo con mis papas y hermanos. Mis principales logros es darle una Buena calidad de vida a mi familia, tener una casa propia y lograr que mi negocio crezca. 
Teresa ha demostrado ser una clienta cumplida, ya que pago puntualmente un crédito anterior con Kubo Financiero.
texts.en:
Teresa is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

“Hi, my name is Teresa.  I am 50 years old, and I am married.  I have two children who are now independent.  My daughter supports me financially.

I have been making women’s and men’s underwear for 20 years.  I make my sales for wholesale at a market.

I am going to use the loan to buy rolls of fabric.  By purchasing fabric wholesale, I am able to get greater profits.

I have a seamstress shop in the upper part of my house.  My business is a family business; I work with my parents and siblings.  My main achievements are giving my family a good quality of life, having my own home, and managing to have my business grow.”

Teresa has shown herself to be a reliable client.  She punctually paid a previous loan with Kubo Financiero.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale in order to improve profit

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is a 26-year-old married man with one son. Elman is an IDP person (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He is a very successful entrepreneur who sells chicken and duck, which brings him a stable income. Elman is a very hardworking man. For the past three years, he has been raising chickens and ducks and is very active in poultry. He usually buys small ducks, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His father helps him in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business, Elman's monthly income is 120 AZN. He has applied for his first loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue

loans.use: to buy more small chickens

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 44 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 46. He is the father of five children. He has spent many years in maize production, and he plans to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Abdul Aziz

texts.en:
Abdul-Aziz is married and has spent one year in maize production. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es: Evelia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Petoa,Santa Bárbara. Hace 1 año que ella decidió establecer su propio negocio, tiene a la venta productos de la canasta básica como ser refrescos, embutidos, carnes, churros, sal, café, condimentos, manteca, harina, arroz y otros. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos para la venta como refrescos, churros, embutidos, harina, carne y lácteos y así poder aumentar sus ventar y obtener mayor ganancia. Ella piensa en un futuro construir su propio local para el negocio.
texts.en:
Evelia is 45 years old.  She is married, has four children, and lives in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Bárbara.  It has been one year since she decided to start her own business.  She sells basic needs items such as soft drinks, cold cuts, meats, chips, salt, coffee, condiments, shortening, flour, rice and others.

The loan she has applied for is for 6,000 Lempiras, and she is going to invest it in the purchase of more products to sell, such as soft drinks, chips, cold cuts, flour, meat and dairy products, so that she can increase her sales and earn a better income.  In the future, she would like to build her own store for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as meats, soft drinks, cold cuts, chips, flour and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 60s, is married with seven children; only two are still in school and the rest are grown-ups. She has been running several businesses, including selling chicken eggs, pork, and clothes door to door. She has been in her businesses for ten years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Regina's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more chicks to raise and then sell their eggs, more pigs to slaughter and sell the meat (pork), and clothes to sell from door to door. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to buy a fridge, pay college fees for the two children who are still studying, renovated her house which was leaking, and cover household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy 500 chicks and chicken feed for feeding chickens in order to sell their eggs. She dreams of building a shop for her businesses.

Regina will share this loan with her loan group, Saadani, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 500 chicks and chicken feed for feeding chickens in order to sell their eggs.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad  vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Maria solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 34, lives in the family house with her husband and their four children.  She has been selling tortillas at her house for ten years.  She works from Mondays through Sundays.  She has a lot of clientele.  She is a very hard-working and kind person.  With the income that she gets, and with help from her husband, they manage to pay for their household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is one hundred pounds] in order to continue making the tortillas.  This way she will get improved profits in order to have better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is one hundred pounds] and lime powder.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.fr:
Séraphine  fait partie du groupe Abadahemuka   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 44 ans et est marié à  Joseph,  un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce de beignets depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine  pour la préparation de beaucoup de beignets   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, il assure les besoins fondamentaux de sa famille (alimentation, logement et les soins de santé) et il a déjà acheté un porc.
texts.en:
Séraphine is a member of the Abadahemuka group and lives in Gitega. She is 44 years old and married to Joseph, a mason. Together they have 3 children.

Séraphine has been in the pastry business for 6 years. She is on her sixteenth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she obtains, she will increase her business capital and purchase flour in bulk, in order to prepare pastries for resale and increase her earnings. With the profits from her business, Séraphine takes care of her family's fundamental needs (food, housing, and health needs) and she has already been able to purchase a pig.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase flour in bulk to be able to prepare pastries for resale and increase her profits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase "pagne" cloth in bulk for resale to increase her earnings

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, necesita comprar herbicidas, insecticidas, abono y pagara mozos para sembrar, para que su producción sea buena, con el préstamo que se le dio antes el sembró sin ningún problema, aumento sus ganancias, la cosecha fue abundante y las condiciones familiares son diferentes.
Su familia sigue estable, está compuesta con el mismo número de personas, siguen muy saludables y dispuestos a seguir apoyándolo.
texts.en:
Felipe needs to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer and to pay workers to plant.  He needs to do this so that he gets a good production.  With the previous loan he planted without any problem, increased his profits, got an abundant harvest, and his family conditions have changed.

His family continues to be stable.  It is comprised of the same number of people.  They continue to be healthy, and they are prepared to continue helping him.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer and to pay workers to plant.

loans.name: Xayala

texts.en: Xayala is a 32 year old married woman and is the mother of two children She is an IDP (internally displaced person). She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family. Xayala is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that she is working every day without rest. She bakes bread daily and takes it to the market daily. Her breads are very famous because they are made in a traditional style which involves cooking them in special ovens. Her profit from this business is 150 AZN. Xayala is opting for a loan of 1900 AZN because she needs more working capital in order to continue investing in her business. This investment will help her to buy raw materials for making bread, such as flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, and more. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bread.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes de hombre y mujeres, shampoo, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Maria desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes ,etc. ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria, age 46, sells all types of personal use items like lotions, deodorants, creams, men’s and women’s perfumes, and shampoo, etc.  Her business is located at her house.  With the profits that she gets from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they manage to pay their household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.

Maria wishes to expand her business.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy everything needed like perfumes, nail polish, and deodorants, etc.  She has a lot of clientele because she sells her products at affordable prices.

With the requested help she will be able to get improved profits.  This way she will continue giving her family what they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, and deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 32 years old. He is married, with four children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, Saidi wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Burikhon

texts.ru:
Бурихон 23-летний холостой молодой человек. Он со своей семьей живет в селе района Хамадони. Он около 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Бурихон откармливает маленьких бычков, и после того как они набирают достаточный вес, продает их на скотном рынке. Бурихон с ранних лет работал на скотном дворе и по сей день там же проводит свое время. Кормить, поить и ухаживать за скотами вошло в привычку. 
   Бурихон просит кредит, чтобы закупить бычков и пополнить количество поголовья скота на скотном дворе.
texts.en:
Burikhon is a 23 years old, single, young man. He lives with his family in the Hamadoni region. He has worked with cattle breeding for more than 10 years. Burikhon fattens small bull-calves, and after they have gained enough weight, sells them at the livestock market. 

Since his early years, Burikhon worked at the cattle-yard and to this day this is where he spends his time. Feeding, giving water to and caring for the cattle has become a habit. Burikhon requests a loan to purchase bull-calves and increase the number of cattle in the cattle-yard.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She owns a shop in which she sells convenience store items, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and snacks, among other things. She has been running this business for many years and thus has a lot of experience in sales which allows her to do well. The business is located in her house, which in turn is located in a busy area. Maria has a lot of clients since she has a well stocked shop; people prefer her to the competition as she always has what they need at good quality, good prices, and excellent service. 

Like any good businessperson, Maria wants to grow her business and make an investment. She is therefore requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase staple foods, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. Maria has good credit and assures that she will pay off the loan. She hopes that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Haykaz

texts.en:
Haykaz is a young private entrepreneur from Vanadzor city of Lori region. He lives with his mother and brother. His mother and brother are employed in the private sector. All family members work hard to earn a living. To take care of his family, Haykaz runs a small local retail shop for shoes. It has already been about two years since Haykaz started his small business, which is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue developing his small business, Haykaz needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him greatly, enabling him to purchase a car. The latter will help him organize his business in a more efficient way. Haykaz and his family members will highly appreciate the lenders support, and will be thankful to them for helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their small business.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is from the Odzun village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband (in the photo) and three sons. Her sons are currently labor migrants in Russia; they work there and send some money to their parents to take care of their needs. Maya is a teacher in the village local school. Her salary is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that alone. With the help of her husband, Maya is engaged in beekeeping; breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, and hens; and cultivating wheat, sunflower, grass, and strawberries. Maya's husband realizes the agricultural products are a very important source of income for them. Their honey has a very high demand in the local market. To sustain and develop their agribusiness, Maya needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase twenty beehives. As this is Maya’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Maya and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase twenty beehives.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом порядочная женщина. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Гуландом более 10 лет работает в доме инвалидов. Она работает поваром. Она всегда мечтала, чтобы один из ее детей стал врачом. Гуландом отправила старшего сына за границу, чтобы учится. Данное время ее сын учится на 1 курсе Чувашского государственного университета. Он учится по специальности лечебное дело. Гуландом мечтает, чтобы ее второй сын стал лётчиком. Двое ее детей учатся в средней школе. Гуландом запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulandom is a respectable woman. She is 38 years old. She is married and raising three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Gulandom has worked in a nursing home for more than 10 years. She works as a cook. 

Gulandom always dreamed about one of her children becoming a doctor. She sent her eldest son abroad to study. Currently her son is in the first year of the Chuvash State University. He specializes in medical studies. Gulandom dreams of her second son becoming a pilot. Two of her children go to secondary school. 

Gulandom requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar to pay for her son's tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education
